CVE-2021-44228
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.47%

1 posts

# Summary Log4j versions prior to 2.16.0 are subject to a remote code execution vulnerability via the ldap JNDI parser. As per [Apache's Log4j security guide](https://logging.apache.org/log4j/2.x/security.html): Apache Log4j2 <=2.14.1 JNDI features used in configuration, log messages, and parameters do not protect against attacker controlled LDAP and other JNDI related endpoints. An attacker who

ntkramer@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-20T16:41:54.000Z ##

🥶 & #threatintel: There has been a significant increase in attempts to exploit a remote code execution vulnerability in the popular Java logging library Apache Log4j, identified as CVE-2021-44228 and CVE-2021-45046.

https://viz.greynoise.io/tag/apache-log4j-rce-attempt?days=30

##

CVE-2021-45046
(9.0 None)

EPSS: 97.40%

1 posts

# Impact The fix to address [CVE-2021-44228](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-44228) in Apache Log4j 2.15.0 was incomplete in certain non-default configurations. This could allow attackers with control over Thread Context Map (MDC) input data when the logging configuration uses a non-default Pattern Layout with either a Context Lookup (for example, $${ctx:loginId}) or a Thread Context Ma

##

CVE-2023-22527
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.30%

14 posts

A template injection vulnerability on older versions of Confluence Data Center and Server allows an unauthenticated attacker to achieve RCE on an affected instance. Customers using an affected version must take immediate action. Most recent supported versions of Confluence Data Center and Server are not affected by this vulnerability as it was ultimately mitigated during regular version updates.

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-01-23T00:18:51.000Z ##

Threat actors are exploiting a recently patched Atlassian Confluence vulnerability. Tracked as CVE-2023-22527, the vulnerability has a severity rating of 10/10 and allows for unauthenticated remote code execution attacks.

Attacks began on January 19, three days after Atlassian released a patch.

https://mastodon.social/@shadowserver@infosec.exchange/111799051613677052

After the attacks got underway, a technical write-up and proof-of-concept code was also published on a Chinese tech blog. https://www.ctfiot.com/158511.html

##

CVE-2022-47966
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.12%

2 posts

Multiple Zoho ManageEngine on-premise products, such as ServiceDesk Plus through 14003, allow remote code execution due to use of Apache xmlsec (aka XML Security for Java) 1.4.1, because the xmlsec XSLT features, by design in that version, make the application responsible for certain security protections, and the ManageEngine applications did not provide those protections.

Nuclei template

5 repos

https://github.com/horizon3ai/CVE-2022-47966

https://github.com/ACE-Responder/CVE-2022-47966_checker

https://github.com/Inplex-sys/CVE-2022-47966

https://github.com/vonahisec/CVE-2022-47966-Scan

https://github.com/shameem-testing/PoC-for-ME-SAML-Vulnerability

simontsui at 2024-01-24T15:01:40.592Z ##

Zoho ManageEngine security advisory: CVE-2024-0252 (8.8 high severity, disclosed 10 January 2024) authenticated remote code execution vulnerability. Affects Builds 6401 and older. Patched in Build 6402.
🔗 https://www.manageengine.com/products/self-service-password/advisory/CVE-2024-0252.html

Why you should care: Multiple nation state attackers previously targeted an aeronautical sector organization using the Zoho ManageEngine RCE CVE-2022-47966

#CVE20240252 #Zoho #manageengine #vulnerability #securityadvisory

##

CVE-2018-1000006
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.08%

1 posts

Affected versions of `electron` may be susceptible to a remote code execution flaw when certain conditions are met: 1. The electron application is running on Windows. 2. The electron application registers as the default handler for a protocol, such as `nodeapp://`. This vulnerability is caused by a failure to sanitize additional arguments to chromium in the command line handler for Electron. Mac

1 repos

https://github.com/CHYbeta/CVE-2018-1000006-DEMO

oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-01-25T16:43:21.000Z ##

CVE-2024-21887
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 96.42%

40 posts

A command injection vulnerability in web components of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Policy Secure (9.x, 22.x) allows an authenticated administrator to send specially crafted requests and execute arbitrary commands on the appliance.

##
simontsui at 2024-02-01T16:17:03.942Z ##

CISA released supplemental directions for Emergency Directive 24-01 Mitigate Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure Vulnerabilities. This assumes anyone running Ivanti Connect Secure or Ivanti Policy Secure solutions have been compromised and the remediation steps include isolating the device from resources, continue threat hunting, performing a factory reset, applying the patch, etc.
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/directives/ed-24-01-mitigate-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-vulnerabilities#SupplementalDirectionV1

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893 #EmergencyDirective

##
simontsui at 2024-01-31T12:00:46.012Z ##

Synactiv reports on Rust payloads first identified by Volexity as dropped during the Ivanti Connect Secure mass exploitation of CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887. These Rust payloads dubbed "KrustyLoader" (edited for grammar) is used to drop a Sliver backdoor. Sliver is a Golang-based C2 framework alternative to Cobalt Strike. IOC provided.
🔗 https://www.synacktiv.com/publications/krustyloader-rust-malware-linked-to-ivanti-connectsecure-compromises

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #Sliver #IOC #threatintel #KrustyLoader

##
simontsui at 2024-01-31T11:44:46.869Z ##

Ivanti identified two new vulnerabilities (one actively exploited) in connection to the Ivanti Connect Secure zero-days from 10 January 2024. They are:

  • CVE-2024-21888 (8.8 high) privilege escalation in web component "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time"
  • CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high, exploited in the wild) sever side request forgery (SSRF) in the SAML component "At the time of publication, the exploitation of CVE-2024-21893 appears to be targeted"

A patch is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1) and ZTA version 22.6R1.3.
🔗 https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
blog post: https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways
security advisory: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2024-21888-Privilege-Escalation-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure?language=en_US

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

simontsui at 2024-01-30T20:53:29.581Z ##

CISA released cybersecurity alert "New Mitigations to Defend Against Exploitation of Ivanti Connect Secure and Policy Secure Gateways" CISA is aware of instances in which sophisticated threat actors have subverted the external integrity checker tool (ICT).
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/30/new-mitigations-defend-against-exploitation-ivanti-connect-secure-and-policy-secure-gateways

##
simontsui at 2024-01-29T13:41:11.382Z ##

Just your periodic update from Ivanti regarding their CVE-2023-46805 (8.2 high) and CVE-2024-21887 (9.1 critical) zero-days (both disclosed 10 January 2024 as exploited in the wild, has Proofs of Concept, mass exploitation):

"Update 26 January: The targeted release of patches for supported versions is delayed, this delay impacts all subsequent planned patch releases. We are now targeting next week to release a patch for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R17x, 9.1R18x, 22.4R2x and 22.5R1.1), Ivanti Policy Secure (versions 9.1R17x, 9.1R18x and 22.5R1x) and ZTA version 22.6R1x.
Patches for supported versions will still be released on a staggered schedule. Instructions on how to upgrade to a supported version will also be provided.
The timing of patch release is subject to change as we prioritize the security and quality of each release. Please ensure you are following this article to receive updates as they become available."
🔗 https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

Hot off the press! Mandiant released additional information about post-exploitation activity by the suspected Chinese state-sponsored threat actor UNC5221 (tracked by Volexity as UTA0178) and provided IOC.
🔗 https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/investigating-ivanti-zero-day-exploitation

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-31T12:00:46.000Z ##

Synactiv reports on Rust payloads first identified by Volexity as dropped during the Ivanti Connect Secure mass exploitation of CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887. These Rust payloads dubbed "KrustyLoader" (edited for grammar) is used to drop a Sliver backdoor. Sliver is a Golang-based C2 framework alternative to Cobalt Strike. IOC provided.
🔗 https://www.synacktiv.com/publications/krustyloader-rust-malware-linked-to-ivanti-connectsecure-compromises

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #Sliver #IOC #threatintel #KrustyLoader

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-31T11:44:46.000Z ##

Ivanti identified two new vulnerabilities (one actively exploited) in connection to the Ivanti Connect Secure zero-days from 10 January 2024. They are:

  • CVE-2024-21888 (8.8 high) privilege escalation in web component "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time"
  • CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high, exploited in the wild) sever side request forgery (SSRF) in the SAML component "At the time of publication, the exploitation of CVE-2024-21893 appears to be targeted"

A patch is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1) and ZTA version 22.6R1.3.
🔗 https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
blog post: https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways
security advisory: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2024-21888-Privilege-Escalation-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure?language=en_US

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-30T20:53:29.000Z ##

CISA released cybersecurity alert "New Mitigations to Defend Against Exploitation of Ivanti Connect Secure and Policy Secure Gateways" CISA is aware of instances in which sophisticated threat actors have subverted the external integrity checker tool (ICT).
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/30/new-mitigations-defend-against-exploitation-ivanti-connect-secure-and-policy-secure-gateways

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-29T13:41:11.000Z ##

Just your periodic update from Ivanti regarding their CVE-2023-46805 (8.2 high) and CVE-2024-21887 (9.1 critical) zero-days (both disclosed 10 January 2024 as exploited in the wild, has Proofs of Concept, mass exploitation):

"Update 26 January: The targeted release of patches for supported versions is delayed, this delay impacts all subsequent planned patch releases. We are now targeting next week to release a patch for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R17x, 9.1R18x, 22.4R2x and 22.5R1.1), Ivanti Policy Secure (versions 9.1R17x, 9.1R18x and 22.5R1x) and ZTA version 22.6R1x.
Patches for supported versions will still be released on a staggered schedule. Instructions on how to upgrade to a supported version will also be provided.
The timing of patch release is subject to change as we prioritize the security and quality of each release. Please ensure you are following this article to receive updates as they become available."
🔗 https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA

decio at 2024-02-02T15:10:12.268Z ##

"yes you read it right - trying to reproduce this weeks Ivanti CVEs has led us into further 0days on a fully patched Ivanti SSLVPN device

We’ll report; but our 90 day policy will restrict any further sharing"

##
simontsui at 2024-02-02T14:45:58.210Z ##

@cert_eu

Update 1 February: A patch addressing all known vulnerabilities is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure version 22.5R2.2 and Ivanti Policy Secure 22.5R1.1.

https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

##
simontsui at 2024-02-01T20:22:13.714Z ##

@dangoodin Patch testing takes time to ensure that threat actors don't figure out a way to bypass the patch, which would then be in itself a new zero-day (when someone other than the vendor knows an existing vulnerability). During their continued investigation and patch testing, they discovered CVE-2024-21888, which they stated "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time" and CVE-2024-21893 (We are only aware of a small number of customers who have been impacted by CVE-2024-21893 at this time.)

The patch they released for about 7 versions of products (Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2, 22.5R1.1 and 22.5R2.2), Ivanti Policy Secure version 22.5R1.1 and ZTA version 22.6R1.3) fix all four vulnerabilities instead of hotfixing two and needing additional patches. "CVE-2023-46805, CVE-2024-21887, CVE-2024-21888, and CVE-2024-21893 are all remediated with the patch."

I can't believe I'm defending Ivanti but rushing a patch would have been worse.

##
simontsui at 2024-01-31T14:27:32.148Z ##

@cert_eu It should be noted in this toot that " A patch is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1) and ZTA version 22.6R1.3." https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
" CVE-2023-46805, CVE-2024-21887, CVE-2024-21888, and CVE-2024-21893 are all remediated with the patch." https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways

##
jbhall56 at 2024-01-31T13:43:16.650Z ##

The security vulnerabilities, tracked as CVE-2023-46805 (CVSS score: 8.2) and CVE-2024-21887 (CVSS score: 9.1), could be abused in tandem to achieve unauthenticated remote code execution on susceptible appliances. https://thehackernews.com/2024/01/chinese-hackers-exploiting-critical-vpn.html

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2024-01-31T11:34:07.000Z ##

More hilarity on #ConnectAround - there’s now two NEW vulnerabilities in Ivanti Pulse Secure, being actively exploited as zero days too - no patches for many versions.

Updated advisory with updated mitigations you need to reapply:
https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

CERT advisory: https://www.bsi.bund.de/SharedDocs/Cybersicherheitswarnungen/DE/2024/2024-205101-1032.pdf?__blob=publicationFile&v=2

Ivanti recommend you factory reset your devices in their advisory.

The patch they released for about 7 versions of products (Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2, 22.5R1.1 and 22.5R2.2), Ivanti Policy Secure version 22.5R1.1 and ZTA version 22.6R1.3) fix all four vulnerabilities instead of hotfixing two and needing additional patches. EPSS: 95.68%

2 posts

Atlassian has been made aware of an issue reported by a handful of customers where external attackers may have exploited a previously unknown vulnerability in publicly accessible Confluence Data Center and Server instances to create unauthorized Confluence administrator accounts and access Confluence instances. Atlassian Cloud sites are not affected by this vulnerability. If your Confluence site

(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 93.05%

39 posts

An authentication bypass vulnerability in the web component of Ivanti ICS 9.x, 22.x and Ivanti Policy Secure allows a remote attacker to access restricted resources by bypassing control checks.

##
simontsui at 2024-02-01T16:17:03.942Z ##

CISA released supplemental directions for Emergency Directive 24-01 Mitigate Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure Vulnerabilities. This assumes anyone running Ivanti Connect Secure or Ivanti Policy Secure solutions have been compromised and the remediation steps include isolating the device from resources, continue threat hunting, performing a factory reset, applying the patch, etc.
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/directives/ed-24-01-mitigate-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-vulnerabilities#SupplementalDirectionV1

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893 #EmergencyDirective

simontsui at 2024-02-01T01:13:29.622Z ##

CISA added yet another vulnerability to the KEV Catalog on the same day. (I get the feeling that they don't like doing that): CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high) Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure, and Neurons Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) Vulnerability
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/31/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog-0

##
simontsui at 2024-01-31T12:00:46.012Z ##

Synactiv reports on Rust payloads first identified by Volexity as dropped during the Ivanti Connect Secure mass exploitation of CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887. These Rust payloads dubbed "KrustyLoader" (edited for grammar) is used to drop a Sliver backdoor. Sliver is a Golang-based C2 framework alternative to Cobalt Strike. IOC provided.
🔗 https://www.synacktiv.com/publications/krustyloader-rust-malware-linked-to-ivanti-connectsecure-compromises

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #Sliver #IOC #threatintel #KrustyLoader

##
simontsui at 2024-01-31T11:44:46.869Z ##

Ivanti identified two new vulnerabilities (one actively exploited) in connection to the Ivanti Connect Secure zero-days from 10 January 2024. They are:

  • CVE-2024-21888 (8.8 high) privilege escalation in web component "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time"
  • CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high, exploited in the wild) sever side request forgery (SSRF) in the SAML component "At the time of publication, the exploitation of CVE-2024-21893 appears to be targeted"

A patch is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1) and ZTA version 22.6R1.3.
🔗 https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
blog post: https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways
security advisory: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2024-21888-Privilege-Escalation-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure?language=en_US

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
simontsui at 2024-01-30T20:53:29.581Z ##

CISA released cybersecurity alert "New Mitigations to Defend Against Exploitation of Ivanti Connect Secure and Policy Secure Gateways" CISA is aware of instances in which sophisticated threat actors have subverted the external integrity checker tool (ICT).
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/30/new-mitigations-defend-against-exploitation-ivanti-connect-secure-and-policy-secure-gateways

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog

##
simontsui at 2024-01-29T13:41:11.382Z ##

Just your periodic update from Ivanti regarding their CVE-2023-46805 (8.2 high) and CVE-2024-21887 (9.1 critical) zero-days (both disclosed 10 January 2024 as exploited in the wild, has Proofs of Concept, mass exploitation):

"Update 26 January: The targeted release of patches for supported versions is delayed, this delay impacts all subsequent planned patch releases. We are now targeting next week to release a patch for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R17x, 9.1R18x, 22.4R2x and 22.5R1.1), Ivanti Policy Secure (versions 9.1R17x, 9.1R18x and 22.5R1x) and ZTA version 22.6R1x.
Patches for supported versions will still be released on a staggered schedule. Instructions on how to upgrade to a supported version will also be provided.
The timing of patch release is subject to change as we prioritize the security and quality of each release. Please ensure you are following this article to receive updates as they become available."
🔗 https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-02T15:35:27.000Z ##

watchTowr reports additional zero-days uncovered on a fully patched Ivanti appliance. No further information due to 90 day vulnerability disclosure policy.
🔗 https://twitter.com/watchtowrcyber/status/1753366975609475472 (just in case someone wants to view it for themselves)

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-01T16:17:03.000Z ##

CISA released supplemental directions for Emergency Directive 24-01 Mitigate Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure Vulnerabilities. This assumes anyone running Ivanti Connect Secure or Ivanti Policy Secure solutions have been compromised and the remediation steps include isolating the device from resources, continue threat hunting, performing a factory reset, applying the patch, etc.
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/directives/ed-24-01-mitigate-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-vulnerabilities#SupplementalDirectionV1

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893 #EmergencyDirective

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-01T01:13:29.000Z ##

CISA added yet another vulnerability to the KEV Catalog on the same day. (I get the feeling that they don't like doing that): CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high) Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure, and Neurons Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) Vulnerability
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/31/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog-0

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-31T11:44:46.000Z ##

Ivanti identified two new vulnerabilities (one actively exploited) in connection to the Ivanti Connect Secure zero-days from 10 January 2024. They are:

  • CVE-2024-21888 (8.8 high) privilege escalation in web component "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time"
  • CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high, exploited in the wild) sever side request forgery (SSRF) in the SAML component "At the time of publication, the exploitation of CVE-2024-21893 appears to be targeted"

A patch is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1) and ZTA version 22.6R1.3.
🔗 https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-29T13:41:11.000Z ##

Just your periodic update from Ivanti regarding their CVE-2023-46805 (8.2 high) and CVE-2024-21887 (9.1 critical) zero-days (both disclosed 10 January 2024 as exploited in the wild, has Proofs of Concept, mass exploitation):

"Update 26 January: The targeted release of patches for supported versions is delayed, this delay impacts all subsequent planned patch releases. We are now targeting next week to release a patch for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R17x, 9.1R18x, 22.4R2x and 22.5R1.1), Ivanti Policy Secure (versions 9.1R17x, 9.1R18x and 22.5R1x) and ZTA version 22.6R1x.
Patches for supported versions will still be released on a staggered schedule. Instructions on how to upgrade to a supported version will also be provided.
The timing of patch release is subject to change as we prioritize the security and quality of each release. Please ensure you are following this article to receive updates as they become available."
🔗 https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

##
simontsui at 2024-02-02T14:45:58.210Z ##

@cert_eu

Update 1 February: A patch addressing all known vulnerabilities is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure version 22.5R2.2 and Ivanti Policy Secure 22.5R1.1.

https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

##
simontsui at 2024-02-01T20:22:13.714Z ##

@dangoodin Patch testing takes time to ensure that threat actors don't figure out a way to bypass the patch, which would then be in itself a new zero-day (when someone other than the vendor knows an existing vulnerability). During their continued investigation and patch testing, they discovered CVE-2024-21888, which they stated "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time" and CVE-2024-21893 (We are only aware of a small number of customers who have been impacted by CVE-2024-21893 at this time.)

The patch they released for about 7 versions of products (Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2, 22.5R1.1 and 22.5R2.2), Ivanti Policy Secure version 22.5R1.1 and ZTA version 22.6R1.3) fix all four vulnerabilities instead of hotfixing two and needing additional patches. "CVE-2023-46805, CVE-2024-21887, CVE-2024-21888, and CVE-2024-21893 are all remediated with the patch."

I can't believe I'm defending Ivanti but rushing a patch would have been worse.

##
simontsui at 2024-01-31T14:27:32.148Z ##

@cert_eu It should be noted in this toot that " A patch is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1) and ZTA version 22.6R1.3." https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
" CVE-2023-46805, CVE-2024-21887, CVE-2024-21888, and CVE-2024-21893 are all remediated with the patch." https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways

##
jbhall56 at 2024-01-31T13:43:16.650Z ##

The security vulnerabilities, tracked as CVE-2023-46805 (CVSS score: 8.2) and CVE-2024-21887 (CVSS score: 9.1), could be abused in tandem to achieve unauthenticated remote code execution on susceptible appliances. https://thehackernews.com/2024/01/chinese-hackers-exploiting-critical-vpn.html

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2024-01-31T11:34:07.000Z ##

More hilarity on #ConnectAround - there’s now two NEW vulnerabilities in Ivanti Pulse Secure, being actively exploited as zero days too - no patches for many versions.

Updated advisory with updated mitigations you need to reapply:
https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

CVEs: CVE-2024-21893 and CVE-2024-21888

CERT advisory: https://www.bsi.bund.de/SharedDocs/Cybersicherheitswarnungen/DE/2024/2024-205101-1032.pdf?__blob=publicationFile&v=2

Ivanti recommend you factory reset your devices in their advisory.

HT @fthy

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-01T20:22:13.000Z ##

@dangoodin Patch testing takes time to ensure that threat actors don't figure out a way to bypass the patch, which would then be in itself a new zero-day (when someone other than the vendor knows an existing vulnerability). During their continued investigation and patch testing, they discovered CVE-2024-21888, which they stated "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time" and CVE-2024-21893 (We are only aware of a small number of customers who have been impacted by CVE-2024-21893 at this time.)

The patch they released for about 7 versions of products (Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2, 22.5R1.1 and 22.5R2.2), Ivanti Policy Secure version 22.5R1.1 and ZTA version 22.6R1.3) fix all four vulnerabilities instead of hotfixing two and needing additional patches. "CVE-2023-46805, CVE-2024-21887, CVE-2024-21888, and CVE-2024-21893 are all remediated with the patch."

I can't believe I'm defending Ivanti but rushing a patch would have been worse.

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-01-21T00:58:04.000Z ##

Security researchers from Assetnote have found new ways to exploit the recent Ivanti zero-days (CVE-2023-46805 & CVE-2024-21887) on older versions of the Connect Secure firmware.

https://www.assetnote.io/resources/research/high-signal-detection-and-exploitation-of-ivantis-pulse-connect-secure-auth-bypass-rce

According to GreyNoise, exploitation of these zero-days has extended from a Chinese APT to cryptomining botnets.

https://www.greynoise.io/blog/ivanti-connect-secure-exploited-to-install-cryptominers

##

CVE-2023-20198
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 92.41%

2 posts

Cisco is aware of active exploitation of a previously unknown vulnerability in the web UI feature of Cisco IOS XE Software when exposed to the internet or to untrusted networks. This vulnerability allows a remote, unauthenticated attacker to create an account on an affected system with privilege level 15 access. The attacker can then use that account to gain control of the affected system. For s

simontsui at 2024-01-29T23:53:53.766Z ##

@campuscodi My report is titled "unpatched Ivanti zero days" and I've been waiting for the past 19 days to have an update that reads "patches are available". This wait is worse than Cisco's CVE-2023-20198, which was unpatched for 6 days. #CveCrowdDeny

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-29T23:53:53.000Z ##

@campuscodi My report is titled "unpatched Ivanti zero days" and I've been waiting for the past 19 days to have an update that reads "patches are available". This wait is worse than Cisco's CVE-2023-20198, which was unpatched for 6 days. #CveCrowdDeny

simontsui at 2024-01-30T19:12:43.047Z ##

@GossiTheDog this sounded very familiar to something I read in an Akamai blog post, and whaddayaknow, Ben Barnea is that same security researcher at Akamai who reported it:

Akamai researcher Ben Barnea found CVE-2024-20652, a security feature bypass vulnerability with a CVSS score of 7.5. The vulnerability itself is in MapUrlToZone, which is a function that is usually called to determine if a URL points to a resource on the machine, inside the network, or on the internet.

This vulnerability is similar to previously disclosed vulnerabilities. It causes MapUrlToZone to conclude that a URL resides in the intranet, while the URL actually points to an internet resource. This can be abused to bypass Outlook’s CVE-2023-23397 patch, and eventually lead to leaking NTLM credentials to a remote (attacker-controlled) destination."

##
h2onolan at 2024-01-27T04:15:41.726Z ##

@Viss was thinking about CVE-2023-23397. but the CVE-2023-35636 shit is wicked.

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-30T19:12:43.000Z ##

@GossiTheDog this sounded very familiar to something I read in an Akamai blog post, and whaddayaknow, Ben Barnea is that same security researcher at Akamai who reported it:

Akamai researcher Ben Barnea found CVE-2024-20652, a security feature bypass vulnerability with a CVSS score of 7.5. The vulnerability itself is in MapUrlToZone, which is a function that is usually called to determine if a URL points to a resource on the machine, inside the network, or on the internet.

This vulnerability is similar to previously disclosed vulnerabilities. It causes MapUrlToZone to conclude that a URL resides in the intranet, while the URL actually points to an internet resource. This can be abused to bypass Outlook’s CVE-2023-23397 patch, and eventually lead to leaking NTLM credentials to a remote (attacker-controlled) destination."

hdm@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-24T01:21:06.000Z ##

The world got weird. Help Systems acquired many security vendors, then spun them out as Fortra, including Cobalt Strike, Core Impact, and this week's flavor of exploitable file transfer software: GoAnywhere MFT (CVE-2024-0204):!

Surely these all belong together.

Looking for exposed GoAnywhere systems? Look for HTML bodies containing: "GoAnywhere Web Client". @runZeroInc search query at: https://www.runzero.com/blog/finding-fortra-goanywhere-mft/

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-23T18:47:14.000Z ##

@GossiTheDog Here is the Fortra security advisory for CVE-2024-0204: https://www.fortra.com/security/advisory/fi-2024-001

9.8 critical (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H)
Discovered "01 December 2023"

Affects: Fortra GoAnywhere MFT 6.x from 6.0.1 and Fortra GoAnywhere MFT 7.x before 7.4.1

Fixed in version 7.4.1 or higher.

No mention* of exploitation.

##

CVE-2024-23897(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 11.94%

32 posts

Jenkins has a built-in command line interface (CLI) to access Jenkins from a script or shell environment. Jenkins uses the args4j library to parse command arguments and options on the Jenkins controller when processing CLI commands. This command parser has a feature that replaces an @ character followed by a file path in an argument with the file’s contents (expandAtFiles). This feature is enab

Nuclei template

14 repos

https://github.com/AbraXa5/Jenkins-CVE-2024-23897

https://github.com/h4x0r-dz/CVE-2024-23897

https://github.com/wjlin0/CVE-2024-23897

https://github.com/binganao/CVE-2024-23897

https://github.com/jenkinsci-cert/SECURITY-3314-3315

https://github.com/raheel0x01/CVE-2024-23897

https://github.com/vmtyan/poc-cve-2024-23897

https://github.com/xaitax/CVE-2024-23897

https://github.com/Vozec/CVE-2024-23897

simontsui at 2024-01-29T19:34:09.140Z ##

Horizon3 discusses factors that could significantly increase the criticality of Jenkins RCE CVE-2024-23897 (9.8 critical): "There are two dangerous Jenkins configuration options that allow unauthenticated attackers to effectively act like authenticated attackers. The “Allow users to sign up” option allows anyone with access to the Jenkins instance to self-register an account. And the “Allow anonymous read access” option gives everyone the Overall/Read permission." The impact matrix alone was worth taking a look at.
🔗 https://www.horizon3.ai/cve-2024-23897-assessing-the-impact-of-the-jenkins-arbitrary-file-leak-vulnerability/

#Jenkins #RCE #CVE_2024_23897 #vulnerability #activeexploitation #eitw

##
simontsui at 2024-01-28T18:36:30.904Z ##

Jenkins RCE CVE-2024-23897 (9.8 critical, proofs of concept publicly available) allegedly being exploited in the wild, reported 3 days ago by a graduate student researcher* of Sky Computing Lab, UC Berkeley.

#Jenkins #RCE #CVE_2024_23897 #vulnerability #activeexploitation #eitw

##
mttaggart@infosec.town at 2024-01-25T14:07:46.265Z ##

Good morning! Have a fairly gnarly RCE in #Jenkins:

Jenkins uses the args4j library to parse command arguments and options on the Jenkins controller when processing CLI commands. This command parser has a feature that replaces an @ character followed by a file path in an argument with the file’s contents (expandAtFiles). This feature is enabled by default and Jenkins 2.441 and earlier, LTS 2.426.2 and earlier does not disable it.
www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2024-01-24/#SECURITY-3314

#CVE_2024_23897

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-29T19:34:09.000Z ##

Horizon3 discusses factors that could significantly increase the criticality of Jenkins RCE CVE-2024-23897 (9.8 critical): "There are two dangerous Jenkins configuration options that allow unauthenticated attackers to effectively act like authenticated attackers. The “Allow users to sign up” option allows anyone with access to the Jenkins instance to self-register an account. And the “Allow anonymous read access” option gives everyone the Overall/Read permission." The impact matrix alone was worth taking a look at.
🔗 https://www.horizon3.ai/cve-2024-23897-assessing-the-impact-of-the-jenkins-arbitrary-file-leak-vulnerability/

#Jenkins #RCE #CVE_2024_23897 #vulnerability #activeexploitation #eitw

Jenkins uses the args4j library to parse command arguments and options on the Jenkins controller when processing CLI commands. This command parser has a feature that replaces an @ character followed by a file path in an argument with the file’s contents (expandAtFiles). This feature is enabled by default and Jenkins 2.441 and earlier, LTS 2.426.2 and earlier does not disable it.

peter@area51.social at 2024-01-31T11:46:00.000Z ##

If you are running Jenkins 2.441 or LTS 2.426.2 and earlier, you'll probably need to upgrade, more so if your Jenkins instance is publicly accessible!

A critical issue with the Jenkins CLI potentially exposing files on the controller

CVE-2024-23897 https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-23897

It seems to be down to the args4j library

https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2024-01-24/

##
jbhall56 at 2024-01-25T13:38:19.502Z ##

The issue, assigned the CVE identifier CVE-2024-23897, has been described as an arbitrary file read vulnerability through the built-in command line interface (CLI) https://thehackernews.com/2024/01/critical-jenkins-vulnerability-exposes.html

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-01-25T11:12:21.000Z ##

Jenkins released a patch for a major vulnerability. Tracked as CVE-2024-23897, the vulnerability has a severity rating of 9.8/10 and impacts the app's CLI component.

The Jenkins team has confirmed various attack scenarios that can allow attackers to retrieve cryptographic keys, delete files, or run malicious code through various methods.

If patches can't be installed, the vulnerability can be mitigated by disabling the CLI component.

https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2024-01-24/

##
peter@area51.social at 2024-01-31T11:46:00.000Z ##

If you are running Jenkins 2.441 or LTS 2.426.2 and earlier, you'll probably need to upgrade, more so if your Jenkins instance is publicly accessible!

A critical issue with the Jenkins CLI potentially exposing files on the controller

CVE-2024-23897 https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-23897

It seems to be down to the args4j library

https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2024-01-24/

#jenkins #cve

CVE-2023-6448
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 6.84%

2 posts

Unitronics Vision Series PLCs and HMIs use default administrative passwords. An unauthenticated attacker with network access to a PLC or HMI can take administrative control of the system.

Treasury’s Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) sanctioned six officials in the Iranian Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps Cyber-Electronic Command (IRGC-CEC), an Iranian government organization responsible for a series of malicious cyber activities against critical infrastructure in the United States and other countries.

CVE-2023-7028
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 4.48%

4 posts

An issue has been discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions from 16.1 prior to 16.1.6, 16.2 prior to 16.2.9, 16.3 prior to 16.3.7, 16.4 prior to 16.4.5, 16.5 prior to 16.5.6, 16.6 prior to 16.6.4, and 16.7 prior to 16.7.2 in which user account password reset emails could be delivered to an unverified email address.

Nuclei template

fredbrooker@witter.cz at 2024-01-25T18:09:52.000Z ##

Over 5,300 internet-exposed GitLab instances are vulnerable to CVE-2023-7028, a zero-click account takeover flaw GitLab warned about earlier this month.

The critical (CVSS score: 10.0) flaw allows attackers to send password reset emails for a targeted account to an attacker-controlled email address, allowing the threat actor to change the password and take over the account.

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/over-5-300-gitlab-servers-exposed-to-zero-click-account-takeover-attacks/

J'ai été victime d'un piratage de mon instance GItlab. J'ai l'impression que la personne a utilisé la vulnérabilité CVE-2023-7028 pour changer le mot de passe du compte admin de l'instance (j'étais en version 16.3.6). D'après les logs, il s'est pas connecté ensuite. L'attaque provient de 3.142.114.26 et whois me dit que c'est Amazonaws. Mais je vois pas d'email d'abuse? Est-ce qu'il y a une procédure de signalement? #sysadmin #gitlab

##

CVE-2023-34048
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 3.06%

4 posts

vCenter Server contains an out-of-bounds write vulnerability in the implementation of the DCERPC protocol. A malicious actor with network access to vCenter Server may trigger an out-of-bounds write potentially leading to remote code execution.

ChrisShort@hachyderm.io at 2024-01-22T16:17:01.000Z ##

Suggested Read: vCenter Server vulnerability exploited for two years https://www.thestack.technology/vcenter-server-vulnerability-cve-2023-34048/?ref=the-stack-newsletter #devopsish

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-22T15:45:50.000Z ##

@Walker CVE-2023-34048 was added to CISA's KEV Catalog today 22 January 2024. This is based on Mandiant's assessment that the Chinese state-sponsored threat actor UNC3886 exploited this vulnerability as a zero-day since at least late 2021.

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-22T15:13:57.000Z ##

CISA adds CVE-2023-34048 (9.8 critical, disclosed 25 October 2023 by VMware, reported by Mandiant as exploited as a zero-day since 2021) VMware vCenter Server Out-of-Bounds Write Vulnerability to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog.
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/22/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog

kasper@digitalcourage.social at 2024-01-26T16:05:32.000Z ##

Bei Fefe entdeckt:

PDF mit Abschlußbericht von r-tec zum #Cyberangriff auf kommunlen IT-Dienstleister #Südwestfalen-IT (#SIT) im Oktober 2023 durch #Ransomware-Verschlüsselung mit #Akira.

Einfallstor war wohl das #VPN und dort möglicherweise eine von #Cisco im September 2023 veröffentlichte und behobene Sicherheitslücke (CVE-2023-20269) oder (oder im Zusammenhang damit) Brute-Force-Kennwortraten; dann Angriff auf Windows-Domäne. Beginn der Verschlüsselung von Servern und einigen Clients (was von Südwestfalen-IT relativ schnell bemerkt wurde).

https://forumwk.de/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/SIT_Incident_Response_Bericht_210777_v0.15_blackened_signed_confidential.pdf

(5.3 MEDIUM)

A Missing Authentication for Critical Function vulnerability in Juniper Networks Junos OS on SRX Series allows an unauthenticated, network-based attacker to cause limited impact to the file system integrity. simontsui at 2024-01-29T15:33:14.405Z ##

Juniper out-of-cycle security advisory for Junos OS SRX Series and EX Series:

  • CVE-2024-21619 (5.3 medium) unauthenticated information disclosure
  • CVE-2023-36846 (5.3 medium) unauthenticated remote impact to file system integrity (note: added to KEV Catalog on 13 November 2023)
  • CVE-2024-21620 (8.8 high) improper neutralization of input (cross-site scripting)
  • CVE-2023-36851 (5.3 medium) unauthenticated remote impact to file system integrity (note: added to KEV Catalog on 13 November 2023)

🔗 https://supportportal.juniper.net/s/article/2024-01-Out-of-Cycle-Security-Bulletin-Junos-OS-SRX-Series-and-EX-Series-Multiple-vulnerabilities-in-J-Web-have-been-addressed?language=en_US

##

CVE-2023-5178
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 1.49%

2 posts

A use-after-free vulnerability was found in drivers/nvme/target/tcp.c` in `nvmet_tcp_free_crypto` due to a logical bug in the NVMe-oF/TCP subsystem in the Linux kernel. This issue may allow a malicious user to cause a use-after-free and double-free problem, which may permit remote code execution or lead to local privilege escalation problem.

todb at 2024-02-02T15:58:07.235Z ##

CVE-2023-5178 is pretty neat.

But, the attacker can't arbitrarily surprise a victim into loading this nvme-tcp driver, though, right? In order to #exploit this bug, you need to already be in a position to send malformed PDU headers to the victim, so they already have to be using this stuff, and you (the attacker) are either already local, or spoofing the remote nvme controller, near as I can tell.

I know basically nothing about fibre channel storage protocols, but this one can run over #TCP so I got to digging into it. I wonder how popular it is for NAS. Seems pretty cool and lickety-split quick.

https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2023/10/15/1

https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2023-5178

##
todb@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-02T15:58:07.000Z ##

CVE-2023-5178 is pretty neat.

But, the attacker can't arbitrarily surprise a victim into loading this nvme-tcp driver, though, right? In order to #exploit this bug, you need to already be in a position to send malformed PDU headers to the victim, so they already have to be using this stuff, and you (the attacker) are either already local, or spoofing the remote nvme controller, near as I can tell.

I know basically nothing about fibre channel storage protocols, but this one can run over #TCP so I got to digging into it. I wonder how popular it is for NAS. Seems pretty cool and lickety-split quick.

https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2023/10/15/1

https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2023-5178

##

CVE-2022-48618
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.69%

10 posts

The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in macOS Ventura 13.1, watchOS 9.2, iOS 16.2 and iPadOS 16.2, tvOS 16.2. An attacker with arbitrary read and write capability may be able to bypass Pointer Authentication. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been exploited against versions of iOS released before iOS 15.7.1.

simontsui at 2024-02-01T05:55:03.375Z ##

There's some degree of cybersecurity-hostility (as opposed to user-friendly) that a company can bury an exploited vulnerability affecting their product in a 2 year old security advisory, and the ONLY reason the general public is aware of it is from a government announcement.

#Apple #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #activeexploitation #vulnerability #KEV #CVE_2022_48618

##
simontsui at 2024-01-31T16:01:24.863Z ##

CISA adds CVE-2022-48618 to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog.
Apple Multiple Products Improper Authentication Vulnerability: Apple iOS, iPadOS, macOS, tvOS, and watchOS contain an improper authentication vulnerability that allows an attacker with read and write capabilities to bypass Pointer Authentication.
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/31/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog

#Apple #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #activeexploitation #vulnerability #KEV #CVE_2022_48618

  • CVE-2023-36846 (5.3 medium) unauthenticated remote impact to file system integrity (note: added to KEV Catalog on 13 November 2023)
  • CVE-2024-21620 (8.8 high) improper neutralization of input (cross-site scripting)
  • CVE-2023-36851 (5.3 medium) unauthenticated remote impact to file system integrity (note: added to KEV Catalog on 13 November 2023)

🔗 https://supportportal.juniper.net/s/article/2024-01-Out-of-Cycle-Security-Bulletin-Junos-OS-SRX-Series-and-EX-Series-Multiple-vulnerabilities-in-J-Web-have-been-addressed?language=en_US

#Juniper #JunosOS #vulnerability #CVE_2024_21619 #CVE_2023_36846 #CVE_2024_21620 #CVE_2023_36851 #KEV #eitw #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-29T15:33:14.000Z ##

  • CVE-2024-21619 (5.3 medium) unauthenticated information disclosure
  • CVE-2023-36846 (5.3 medium) unauthenticated remote impact to file system integrity (note: added to KEV Catalog on 13 November 2023)

##

CVE-2014-0016(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.34%

2 posts

stunnel before 5.00, when using fork threading, does not properly update the state of the OpenSSL pseudo-random number generator (PRNG), which causes subsequent children with the same process ID to use the same entropy pool and allows remote attackers to obtain private keys for EC (ECDSA) or DSA certificates.

emaste@mastodon.social at 2024-01-31T22:30:01.000Z ##

@simondassow @gyptazy E.g. in a writeup for CVE-2014-0016 and CVE-2014-0017:

> OSes with sequential PID generation are then less vulnerable than OSes with random PID (AFAIK only OpenBSD).

https://blog.0xbadc0de.be/archives/218#more-218

CVE-2023-39238

1 posts

It is identified a format string vulnerability in ASUS RT-AX56U V2. This vulnerability is caused by lacking validation for a specific value within its set_iperf3_svr.cgi module. An unauthenticated remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability without privilege to perform remote arbitrary code execution, arbitrary system operation or disrupt service.

##

CVE-2024-23738
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.27%

4 posts

An issue in Postman version 10.22 and before on macOS allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via the RunAsNode and enableNodeClilnspectArguments settings.

1 repos

https://github.com/V3x0r/CVE-2024-23738

H3liumb0y at 2024-01-29T09:25:15.696Z ##

"🚨 Vulnerability in Postman up until 10.22 for macOS - CVE-2024-23738 🚨"

A severe code injection vulnerability, CVE-2024-23738, affects Postman versions up to 10.22 on macOS, posing a significant threat. This flaw allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code through specific settings (RunAsNode and enableNodeClilnspectArguments). Rated at a high CVSS v3 score of 9.8, it requires immediate attention. Postman is an API platform for building and using APIs. No current exploits or known active exploitation. Stay vigilant! 🛡️💻

Source: PRIOn and V3x0r's Github

Tags: #CVE202423738 #CyberSecurity #CodeInjection #Postman #macOS #Vulnerability #InfoSec #PatchManagement 🚀🔐

##

CVE-2020-3259
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.24%

2 posts

A vulnerability in the web services interface of Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software and Cisco Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to retrieve memory contents on an affected device, which could lead to the disclosure of confidential information. The vulnerability is due to a buffer tracking issue when the software parses invalid URLs

GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2024-01-31T04:49:31.000Z ##

🚨 patch your Cisco AnyConnect boxes 🚨

For a 2020 vulnerability. Really.

Lots of ransomware cases coming in for Cisco AnyConnect/ASA recently and find finally we know how - CVE-2020-3259

It was a vuln which allowed a CitrixBleed style memory dump, found by a Russian research org now under US sanctions. Ransomware operators have an exploit.

Sadly it looks like many orgs never patched.

https://www.truesec.com/hub/blog/akira-ransomware-and-exploitation-of-cisco-anyconnect-vulnerability-cve-2020-3259

#threatintel

##

CVE-2024-20652
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.20%

2 posts

Windows HTML Platforms Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

simontsui at 2024-01-30T19:12:43.047Z ##

@GossiTheDog this sounded very familiar to something I read in an Akamai blog post, and whaddayaknow, Ben Barnea is that same security researcher at Akamai who reported it:

Akamai researcher Ben Barnea found CVE-2024-20652, a security feature bypass vulnerability with a CVSS score of 7.5. The vulnerability itself is in MapUrlToZone, which is a function that is usually called to determine if a URL points to a resource on the machine, inside the network, or on the internet.

This vulnerability is similar to previously disclosed vulnerabilities. It causes MapUrlToZone to conclude that a URL resides in the intranet, while the URL actually points to an internet resource. This can be abused to bypass Outlook’s CVE-2023-23397 patch, and eventually lead to leaking NTLM credentials to a remote (attacker-controlled) destination."

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-30T19:12:43.000Z ##

@GossiTheDog this sounded very familiar to something I read in an Akamai blog post, and whaddayaknow, Ben Barnea is that same security researcher at Akamai who reported it:

Akamai researcher Ben Barnea found CVE-2024-20652, a security feature bypass vulnerability with a CVSS score of 7.5. The vulnerability itself is in MapUrlToZone, which is a function that is usually called to determine if a URL points to a resource on the machine, inside the network, or on the internet.

This vulnerability is similar to previously disclosed vulnerabilities. It causes MapUrlToZone to conclude that a URL resides in the intranet, while the URL actually points to an internet resource. This can be abused to bypass Outlook’s CVE-2023-23397 patch, and eventually lead to leaking NTLM credentials to a remote (attacker-controlled) destination."

CVE-2024-23222(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.18%

6 posts

A type confusion issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in tvOS 17.3, iOS 17.3 and iPadOS 17.3, macOS Sonoma 14.3, iOS 16.7.5 and iPadOS 16.7.5, Safari 17.3, macOS Ventura 13.6.4, macOS Monterey 12.7.3. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been exploited.

simontsui at 2024-01-31T18:47:21.429Z ##

Apple Vision Pro won't officially release until 02 February 2024 and it already has an actively exploited zero-day
CVE-2024-23222: A type confusion issue in WebKit was addressed with improved checks. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been exploited.
(as noted by others, this was disclosed 22 January 2024 by Apple across multiple products and added to the CISA KEV Catalog 23 January)
🔗 https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT214070

#Apple #vulnerability #zeroday #activeexploitation #eitw #CVE_2024_23222 #VisionPro #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA

CISA adds CVE-2024-23222 to the KEV Catalog. Disclosed on 22 January 2024 by Apple, this exploited zero-day affects WebKit, and was patched in tvOS 17.3, iOS 17.3 and iPadOS 17.3, macOS Sonoma 14.3, iOS 16.7.5 and iPadOS 16.7.5, Safari 17.3, macOS Ventura 13.6.4, macOS Monterey 12.7.3.
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/23/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-23T12:31:50.000Z ##

The issue, tracked as CVE-2024-23222, is a type confusion bug in the WebKit browser engine that could be exploited by a threat actor to achieve arbitrary code execution when processing maliciously crafted web content. https://thehackernews.com/2024/01/apple-issues-patch-for-critical-zero.html

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-22T19:10:40.000Z ##

Apple backported patches for previously identified zero-days CVE-2023-42916 (6.5 medium) and CVE-2023-42917 (8.8 high) in macOS Sonoma 14.1.2.* (edit: wrote the wrong product) These were initially disclosed in 30 November 2023 by Apple as exploited zero-days, and reported by Clément Lecigne of Google's Threat Analysis Group. Google TAG has historically reported on zero-days developed and exploited by surveillance/spyware vendors.

simontsui at 2024-01-26T01:10:51.189Z ##

Microsoft MSRC security advisories:

  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0804 Insufficient policy enforcement in iOS Security UI
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0805 Inappropriate implementation in Downloads
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0806 Use after free in Passwords
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0807 Use after free in WebAudio
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0808 Integer underflow in WebUI
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0809 Inappropriate implementation in Autofill
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0810 Insufficient policy enforcement in DevTools
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0811 Inappropriate implementation in Extensions API
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0812 Inappropriate implementation in Accessibility
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0813 Use after free in Reading Mode
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0814 Incorrect security UI in Payments
  • Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability CVE-2024-21326: (9.6 critical)
  • Microsoft Edge for Android Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-21382: (4.3 medium)
  • Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability CVE-2024-21383: (3.3 low)
  • Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability CVE-2024-21385: (8.3 high)
  • Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability CVE-2024-21387: (5.3 medium)

Of the five new vulnerabilities disclosed, they are all marked Not Publicly Disclosed, Not Exploited and Exploitation Less Likely. See the original Google Chrome security advisory.

#Microsoft #MSRC #securityadvisory #vulnerability #Chromium #Google #Chrome #Edge

##

CVE-2022-44117
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.12%

2 posts

Boa 0.94.14rc21 is vulnerable to SQL Injection via username.

TomSellers at 2024-02-01T20:23:50.994Z ##

Text of CVE-2022-44117 is:

Boa 0.94.14rc21 is vulnerable to SQL Injection via username.

Given what the Boa webserver does this CVE is probably BS. There are multiple other CVEs that have been disputed for the same reason.

Updates to Boa stopped in 2005 so, like, your probably not doing great if it is in your environment but lets not falsely assign blame.

#security

##
TomSellers@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-01T20:23:50.000Z ##

Google TAG has historically reported on zero-days developed and exploited by surveillance/spyware vendors.

CVE-2021-23015
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.10%

1 posts

On BIG-IP 15.1.x before 15.1.3, 14.1.x before 14.1.4.2, 13.1.0.8 through 13.1.3.6, and all versions of 16.0.x, when running in Appliance Mode, an authenticated user assigned the 'Administrator' role may be able to bypass Appliance Mode restrictions utilizing undisclosed iControl REST endpoints. Note: Software versions which have reached End of Technical Support (EoTS) are not evaluated.

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-22T15:41:06.000Z ##

Ron Bowes @iagox86 of @greynoise blogs about the Confusing History of F5 BIG-IP RCE Vulnerabilities, stemming from a unidentified shell-injection attack against the filePath parameter in the F5 BIG-IP login page. This turned out to be CVE-2021-23015, but the path to figuring that out is an interesting read.
🔗 https://www.labs.greynoise.io/grimoire/2024-01-14-f5-rce-explained/

CVE-2023-36485
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

2 posts

The workflow-engine of ILIAS before 7.23 and 8 before 8.3 allows remote authenticated users to run arbitrary system commands on the application server as the application user via a malicious BPMN2 workflow definition file.

renereh1@neos.social at 2024-01-24T18:21:56.000Z ##

Kann mir jemand erklären, warum bei CVE-2023-36485 und CVE-2023-36486 die CVSS Metrik PR:L gegeben ist? @bsi (ihr habt die Untersuchung gemacht)

Klar, in ILIAS sind für Module Individuelle Rechteeinstellungen möglich aber in welchem real world Szenario würde man bei dem Modul WFE (Prozessautomatisierung) die "write" Rechte einer low privileged Usergruppe geben? (Per default ist schon alleine der Zugriff nur für die Rolle "Administrator" gestattet).

Würde es gerne nachvollziehen können.

##
renereh1@neos.social at 2024-01-24T18:21:56.000Z ##

Kann mir jemand erklären, warum bei CVE-2023-36485 und CVE-2023-36486 die CVSS Metrik PR:L gegeben ist? @bsi (ihr habt die Untersuchung gemacht)

(Per default ist schon alleine der Zugriff nur für die Rolle "Administrator" gestattet).

Würde es gerne nachvollziehen können.

CVE-2024-23898
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

2 posts

Jenkins has a built-in command line interface (CLI) to access Jenkins from a script or shell environment. Since Jenkins 2.217 and LTS 2.222.1, one of the ways to communicate with the CLI is through a WebSocket endpoint. This endpoint relies on the default Jenkins web request authentication functionality, like HTTP Basic authentication with API tokens, or session cookies. This endpoint is enabled

CVE-2023-46446
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

1 posts

### Summary An issue in AsyncSSH v2.14.0 and earlier allows attackers to control the remote end of an SSH client session via packet injection/removal and shell emulation. ### Details The rogue session attack targets any SSH client connecting to an AsyncSSH server, on which the attacker must have a shell account. The goal of the attack is to log the client into the attacker's account without the

communityblog.fedoraproject.org@communityblog.fedoraproject.org at 2024-01-26T10:14:21.000Z ##

This is a weekly report from the I&R (Infrastructure & Release Engineering) Team. It also contain updates for CPE (Community Platform Engineering) Team as the CPE initiatives are in most cases tied to I&R work.

We provide you both infographic and text version of the weekly report. If you just want to quickly look at what we did, just look at the infographic. If you are interested in more in depth details look below the infographic.

Week: 22 Jan – 26 Jan 2024

[🖼 I&R infographic]

[🖼 I&R infographic] [🖼 I&R infographic]

Infrastructure & Release Engineering

Purpose of this team is to take care of day to day business regarding CentOS and Fedora Infrastructure and Fedora release engineering work.
It’s responsible for services running in Fedora and CentOS infrastructure and preparing things for the new Fedora release (mirrors, mass branching, new namespaces etc.).
List of planned/in-progress issues

Fedora Infra

  • Dealing with IPA/authentication outage – it seems to be mostly fixed
  • Move IRC nagios alerts to Matrix
  • Deploy rpmautospec version 0.3.8+ to koji
  • proxies: adjust logrotate to xz logs
  • Enable Auto-Signing for f40-rebuild Mass-Rebuild Tag

CentOS Infra including CentOS CI

  • Update pungi on CS Koji to match Brew’s version

Release Engineering

  • F40 schedule postponed by one week, due to issues during mass rebuild
  • F40 mass rebuild currently ongoing
  • Use DNF 5 as package manager for Mock
  • Create EPEL 10 package signing key

CPE Initiatives

EPEL

Extra Packages for Enterprise Linux (or EPEL) is a Fedora Special Interest Group that creates, maintains, and manages a high quality set of additional packages for Enterprise Linux, including, but not limited to, Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL), CentOS and Scientific Linux (SL), Oracle Linux (OL).

Updates

  • Backport fix for CVE-2023-46445 and CVE-2023-46446 to python-asyncssh in EPEL 9

Matrix Native Zodbot

With ongoing stability issues with the Matrix <-> IRC bridge and many contributors switching over to Matrix, zodbot has become increasingly unreliable. The bridge is currently shut off completely. This initiative will provide a future proof solution and allow us to conduct meetings without wasting time troubleshooting the bridge and zodbot.

Updates

  • Nonbot now is notifying on pagure repos (new issues and git pushes). This was done previously with a generic maubot webhook plugin, but now uses a pagure-specific plugin. This has the benefit of being able to notify any room about any pagure repo. Additionally, the old generic way was not checking if messages were coming from pagure, now it verifies against the pagure webhook key.

If you have any questions or feedback, please respond to this report or contact us on #redhat-cpe channel on matrix.

https://communityblog.fedoraproject.org/infra-releng-update-week-4-2024/

#InfraReleng #redhat

##

CVE-2024-0808(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.08%

2 posts

Integer underflow in WebUI in Google Chrome prior to 121.0.6167.85 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a malicious file. (Chromium security severity: High)

simontsui at 2024-01-26T01:10:51.189Z ##

Microsoft MSRC security advisories:

  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0804 Insufficient policy enforcement in iOS Security UI
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0805 Inappropriate implementation in Downloads
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0806 Use after free in Passwords
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0807 Use after free in WebAudio
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0808 Integer underflow in WebUI
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0809 Inappropriate implementation in Autofill
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0810 Insufficient policy enforcement in DevTools
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0811 Inappropriate implementation in Extensions API
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0812 Inappropriate implementation in Accessibility
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0813 Use after free in Reading Mode
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0814 Incorrect security UI in Payments

  • Microsoft Edge for Android Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-21382: (4.3 medium)
  • Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability CVE-2024-21383: (3.3 low)
  • Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability CVE-2024-21385: (8.3 high)
  • Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability CVE-2024-21387: (5.3 medium)

Of the five new vulnerabilities disclosed, they are all marked Not Publicly Disclosed, Not Exploited and Exploitation Less Likely. See the original Google Chrome security advisory.

##

CVE-2019-5624
(7.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.08%

1 posts

Rapid7 Metasploit Framework suffers from an instance of CWE-22, Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal') in the Zip import function of Metasploit. Exploiting this vulnerability can allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code in Metasploit at the privilege level of the user running Metasploit. This issue affects: Rapid7 Metasploit Framework version 4.14.0 and p

1 repos

https://github.com/VoidSec/CVE-2019-5624

oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-01-25T16:45:34.000Z ##

On insecure zip handling, Rubyzip and Metasploit RCE (CVE-2019-5624)

##

CVE-2023-7227
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.08%

2 posts

SystemK NVR 504/508/516 versions 2.3.5SK.30084998 and prior are vulnerable to a command injection vulnerability in the dynamic domain name system (DDNS) settings that could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary commands with root privileges.

simontsui at 2024-01-25T16:44:10.918Z ##

CISA released two industrial control systems advisories. It should be noted that SystemK has not responded to requests to work with CISA to mitigate CVE-2023-7227 (9.8 critical), a command injection vulnerability affecting SystemK NVR 504/508/516 versions 2.3.5SK.30084998 and prior. CISA also discovered a public Proof of Concept (PoC) for it.
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/25/cisa-releases-two-industrial-control-systems-advisories

#CISA #ICSAdvisory #CVE_2023_7227

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-25T16:44:10.000Z ##

CISA released two industrial control systems advisories. It should be noted that SystemK has not responded to requests to work with CISA to mitigate CVE-2023-7227 (9.8 critical), a command injection vulnerability affecting SystemK NVR 504/508/516 versions 2.3.5SK.30084998 and prior. CISA also discovered a public Proof of Concept (PoC) for it.
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/25/cisa-releases-two-industrial-control-systems-advisories

#CISA #ICSAdvisory #CVE_2023_7227

1 posts

The Twitter Recommendation Algorithm through ec83d01 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (reduction of reputation score) by arranging for multiple Twitter accounts to coordinate negative signals regarding a target account, such as unfollowing, muting, blocking, and reporting, as exploited in the wild in March and April 2023. Of the five new vulnerabilities disclosed, they are all marked Not Publicly Disclosed, Not Exploited and Exploitation Less Likely. See the original Google Chrome security advisory.

##

CVE-2023-46445
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.07%

1 posts

### Summary An issue in AsyncSSH v2.14.0 and earlier allows attackers to control the extension info message (RFC 8308) via a man-in-the-middle attack. ### Details The rogue extension negotiation attack targets an AsyncSSH client connecting to any SSH server sending an extension info message. The attack exploits an implementation flaw in the AsyncSSH implementation to inject an extension info me

communityblog.fedoraproject.org@communityblog.fedoraproject.org at 2024-01-26T10:14:21.000Z ##

This is a weekly report from the I&R (Infrastructure & Release Engineering) Team. It also contain updates for CPE (Community Platform Engineering) Team as the CPE initiatives are in most cases tied to I&R work.

We provide you both infographic and text version of the weekly report. If you just want to quickly look at what we did, just look at the infographic. If you are interested in more in depth details look below the infographic.

Week: 22 Jan – 26 Jan 2024

[🖼 I&R infographic]

[🖼 I&R infographic] [🖼 I&R infographic]

Infrastructure & Release Engineering

Purpose of this team is to take care of day to day business regarding CentOS and Fedora Infrastructure and Fedora release engineering work.
It’s responsible for services running in Fedora and CentOS infrastructure and preparing things for the new Fedora release (mirrors, mass branching, new namespaces etc.).
List of planned/in-progress issues

Fedora Infra

  • Dealing with IPA/authentication outage – it seems to be mostly fixed
  • Move IRC nagios alerts to Matrix
  • Deploy rpmautospec version 0.3.8+ to koji
  • proxies: adjust logrotate to xz logs
  • Enable Auto-Signing for f40-rebuild Mass-Rebuild Tag

CentOS Infra including CentOS CI

  • Update pungi on CS Koji to match Brew’s version

Release Engineering

  • F40 schedule postponed by one week, due to issues during mass rebuild
  • F40 mass rebuild currently ongoing
  • Use DNF 5 as package manager for Mock
  • Create EPEL 10 package signing key

CPE Initiatives

EPEL

Extra Packages for Enterprise Linux (or EPEL) is a Fedora Special Interest Group that creates, maintains, and manages a high quality set of additional packages for Enterprise Linux, including, but not limited to, Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL), CentOS and Scientific Linux (SL), Oracle Linux (OL).

Updates

  • Backport fix for CVE-2023-46445 and CVE-2023-46446 to python-asyncssh in EPEL 9

Matrix Native Zodbot

With ongoing stability issues with the Matrix <-> IRC bridge and many contributors switching over to Matrix, zodbot has become increasingly unreliable. The bridge is currently shut off completely. This initiative will provide a future proof solution and allow us to conduct meetings without wasting time troubleshooting the bridge and zodbot.

Updates

  • Nonbot now is notifying on pagure repos (new issues and git pushes). This was done previously with a generic maubot webhook plugin, but now uses a pagure-specific plugin. This has the benefit of being able to notify any room about any pagure repo. Additionally, the old generic way was not checking if messages were coming from pagure, now it verifies against the pagure webhook key.

If you have any questions or feedback, please respond to this report or contact us on #redhat-cpe channel on matrix.

https://communityblog.fedoraproject.org/infra-releng-update-week-4-2024/

#InfraReleng #redhat

##

##

CVE-2022-39046
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.07%

2 posts

An issue was discovered in the GNU C Library (glibc) 2.36. When the syslog function is passed a crafted input string larger than 1024 bytes, it reads uninitialized memory from the heap and prints it to the target log file, potentially revealing a portion of the contents of the heap.

jyn@tech.lgbt at 2024-02-01T04:31:09.000Z ##

@hierarchon @cadey

This heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability was inadvertently introduced in glibc 2.37 (August 2022) and subsequently backported to glibc 2.36 while addressing a different, less severe vulnerability (CVE-2022-39046).

nooooooo

##

##

CVE-2022-44037
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.07%

1 posts

An access control issue in APsystems ENERGY COMMUNICATION UNIT (ECU-C) Power Control Software V4.1NA, V3.11.4, W2.1NA, V4.1SAA, C1.2.2 allows attackers to access sensitive data and execute specific commands and functions with full admin rights without authenticating allows him to perform multiple attacks, such as attacking wireless network in the product's range.

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-23T18:12:27.000Z ##

CISA Releases Six Industrial Control Systems Advisories. Interesting notes:

  • APSystems has not responded to requests to work with CISA to mitigate this vulnerability, ergo CVE-2022-44037 (8.8 high) is unpatched.
    • CISA discovered public proof of concept as authored by Momen Eldawakhly (Cyber Guy)
  • Voltronic Power did not respond to CISA's attempts at coordination. Four vulnerabilities are unpatched, including RCE and even unauthenticated administrative password change.
  • Lantronix states that XPort is an old legacy product and is not designed for strong encryption or TLS/SSL encryption. That means they won't fix it.

🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/23/cisa-releases-six-industrial-control-systems-advisories

#CISA #ICS #SecurityAdvisory #vulnerability

CVE-2023-6129
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.06%

4 posts

Issue summary: The POLY1305 MAC (message authentication code) implementation contains a bug that might corrupt the internal state of applications running on PowerPC CPU based platforms if the CPU provides vector instructions. Impact summary: If an attacker can influence whether the POLY1305 MAC algorithm is used, the application state might be corrupted with various application dependent conseque

RichBartlett at 2024-01-30T09:39:46.566Z ##

I'm giving up on the Microsoft Defender 'Exposure Score'. It's flagging multiple devices (all Intel laptops running Windows 10) as vulnerable to CVE-2023-6129, which is specific to PowerPC architecture. If they spent less time flagging OpenSSL issues which are not exploitable and more time looking after their own code/infrastructure I'd be happy. #microsoftdefender #microsoftsecurity

##

CVE-2023-40547
(8.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

5 posts

A remote code execution vulnerability was found in Shim. The Shim boot support trusts attacker-controlled values when parsing an HTTP response. This flaw allows an attacker to craft a specific malicious HTTP request, leading to a completely controlled out-of-bounds write primitive and complete system compromise.

harrysintonen at 2024-01-26T20:10:01.044Z ##

Linux shim has a heap buffer overflow #vulnerability CVE-2023-40547 that allows arbitrary code execution and full system compromise when attacker is able to control the HTTP response.

Fixed in commit https://github.com/rhboot/shim/commit/0226b56513b2b8bd5fd281bce77c40c9bf07c66d as part of https://github.com/rhboot/shim/releases/tag/15.8 #cve #infosec

##
newsycombinator@framapiaf.org at 2024-01-25T20:00:54.000Z ##

CVE-2023-40547 – avoid incorrectly trusting HTTP headers
Link: https://github.com/rhboot/shim/commit/0226b56513b2b8bd5fd281bce77c40c9bf07c66d
Comments: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=39132300

##
nixCraft@mastodon.social at 2024-01-25T19:02:03.000Z ##

Ugh. CVE-2023-40547 is a critical bug that exists in every #Linux boot loader signed in the past decade https://github.com/rhboot/shim/commit/0226b56513b2b8bd5fd281bce77c40c9bf07c66d

##
harrysintonen@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-26T20:10:01.000Z ##

Linux shim has a heap buffer overflow #vulnerability CVE-2023-40547 that allows arbitrary code execution and full system compromise when attacker is able to control the HTTP response.

Fixed in commit https://github.com/rhboot/shim/commit/0226b56513b2b8bd5fd281bce77c40c9bf07c66d as part of https://github.com/rhboot/shim/releases/tag/15.8 #cve #infosec

CVE-2024-21387
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.06%

2 posts

Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability

simontsui at 2024-01-26T01:10:51.189Z ##

Microsoft MSRC security advisories:

  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0804 Insufficient policy enforcement in iOS Security UI
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0805 Inappropriate implementation in Downloads
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0806 Use after free in Passwords
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0807 Use after free in WebAudio
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0808 Integer underflow in WebUI
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0809 Inappropriate implementation in Autofill
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0810 Insufficient policy enforcement in DevTools
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0811 Inappropriate implementation in Extensions API
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0812 Inappropriate implementation in Accessibility
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0813 Use after free in Reading Mode
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0814 Incorrect security UI in Payments
  • Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability CVE-2024-21326: (9.6 critical)
  • Microsoft Edge for Android Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-21382: (4.3 medium)
  • Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability CVE-2024-21383: (3.3 low)
  • Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability CVE-2024-21385: (8.3 high)
  • Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability CVE-2024-21387: (5.3 medium)

Of the five new vulnerabilities disclosed, they are all marked Not Publicly Disclosed, Not Exploited and Exploitation Less Likely. See the original Google Chrome security advisory.
