  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0814 Incorrect security UI in Payments
  • Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability CVE-2024-21326: (9.6 critical)
  • Microsoft Edge for Android Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-21382: (4.3 medium)
  • Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability CVE-2024-21383: (3.3 low)
  • Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability CVE-2024-21385: (8.3 high)
  • Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability CVE-2024-21387: (5.3 medium)

Of the five new vulnerabilities disclosed, they are all marked Not Publicly Disclosed, Not Exploited and Exploitation Less Likely. See the original Google Chrome security advisory.

#Microsoft #MSRC #securityadvisory #vulnerability #Chromium #Google #Chrome #Edge

##

CVE-2023-43622
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

2 posts

An attacker, opening a HTTP/2 connection with an initial window size of 0, was able to block handling of that connection indefinitely in Apache HTTP Server. This could be used to exhaust worker resources in the server, similar to the well known "slow loris" attack pattern. This has been fixed in version 2.4.58, so that such connection are terminated properly after the configured connection timeout

dashdsrdash@tilde.zone at 2024-01-23T16:11:16.000Z ##

@sbug

https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2023-43622

Looks like it will happen in the near future for Debian; in the meantime, if you are concerned, you could turn off HTTPS/2 or rebuild the sid package yourself.

##
sbug@sinnesro.se at 2024-01-23T16:03:39.000Z ##

@dashdsrdash

CVE-2023-43622

It came to my knowledge because we had an external part to a pen test against our company.

CVE-2024-23208
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

1 posts

The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.3, watchOS 10.3, tvOS 17.3, iOS 17.3 and iPadOS 17.3. An app may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

jesterchen@social.tchncs.de at 2024-01-23T08:28:40.000Z ##

"CVE-2024-23208 [important] Kernel
The issue was addressed with improved memory handling.
An app may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges"

##

CVE-2024-22860(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.05%

4 posts

Integer overflow vulnerability in FFmpeg before n6.1, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via the jpegxl_anim_read_packet component in the JPEG XL Animation decoder.

H3liumb0y at 2024-01-29T09:41:25.146Z ##

"⚠️ FFmpeg Vulnerability Alert: CVE-2024-22860 🚨"

A critical vulnerability in FFmpeg before n6.1, identified as CVE-2024-22860, has been disclosed. This integer overflow issue allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code through the jpegxl_anim_read_packet component in the JPEG XL Animation decoder. With a CVSS v3 score of 9.8, it's marked as a severe risk. Notably, this vulnerability has been addressed in FFmpeg version n6.1.

🔗 For more details on this vulnerability, check Tenable's overview: CVE-2024-22860 - Tenable and Debian's security tracker: CVE-2024-22860 - Debian Security Tracker.

Tags: #CyberSecurity #Vulnerability #FFmpeg #CVE2024_22860 #InfoSec #CodeExecution #PatchNow 🛡️💻🔒

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-29T09:41:25.000Z ##

"⚠️ FFmpeg Vulnerability Alert: CVE-2024-22860 🚨"

A critical vulnerability in FFmpeg before n6.1, identified as CVE-2024-22860, has been disclosed. This integer overflow issue allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code through the jpegxl_anim_read_packet component in the JPEG XL Animation decoder. With a CVSS v3 score of 9.8, it's marked as a severe risk. Notably, this vulnerability has been addressed in FFmpeg version n6.1.

🔗 For more details on this vulnerability, check Tenable's overview: CVE-2024-22860 - Tenable and Debian's security tracker: CVE-2024-22860 - Debian Security Tracker.

Tags: #CyberSecurity #Vulnerability #FFmpeg #CVE2024_22860 #InfoSec #CodeExecution #PatchNow 🛡️💻🔒

##

CVE-2024-0679
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

1 posts

The ColorMag theme for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized access due to a missing capability check on the plugin_action_callback() function in all versions up to, and including, 3.1.2. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with subscriber-level access and above, to install and activate arbitrary plugins.

1 repos

https://github.com/RandomRobbieBF/CVE-2024-0679

CVE-2024-20263
(5.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

2 posts

A vulnerability with the access control list (ACL) management within a stacked switch configuration of Cisco Business 250 Series Smart Switches and Business 350 Series Managed Switches could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to bypass protection offered by a configured ACL on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to incorrect processing of ACLs on a stacked configuration when eithe

simontsui at 2024-01-24T16:08:38.302Z ##

Cisco security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-20305 (4.3 medium) Cisco Unity Connection Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20263 (5.8 medium) Cisco Small Business Series Switches Stacked Reload ACL Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20253 (9.9 critical) Cisco Unified Communications Products Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

Regarding all three vulnerabilities: The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.

#Cisco #CVE_2024_20305 #CVE_2024_20263 #CVE_2024_20253 #UnityConnection #UnifiedCommunications #vulnerability

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-24T16:08:38.000Z ##

  • CVE-2024-20263 (5.8 medium) Cisco Small Business Series Switches Stacked Reload ACL Bypass Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20305
(4.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

2 posts

A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Unity Connection could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to conduct a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the interface. This vulnerability exists because the web-based management interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading a user of the inte

  • CVE-2024-21619 (5.3 medium) unauthenticated information disclosure
  • CVE-2023-36846 (5.3 medium) unauthenticated remote impact to file system integrity (note: added to KEV Catalog on 13 November 2023)
  • CVE-2024-21620 (8.8 high) improper neutralization of input (cross-site scripting)
  • CVE-2023-36851 (5.3 medium) unauthenticated remote impact to file system integrity (note: added to KEV Catalog on 13 November 2023)

CVE-2023-49657
(5.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

2 posts

A stored cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists in Apache Superset before 3.0.3. An authenticated attacker with create/update permissions on charts or dashboards could store a script or add a specific HTML snippet that would act as a stored XSS. For 2.X versions, users should change their config to include: TALISMAN_CONFIG = {     "content_security_policy": {         "base-uri": ["'self

simontsui at 2024-01-25T15:12:00.584Z ##

Apache Superset security advisory: CVE-2023-49657 (9.6 critical) A stored cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists in Apache Superset before 3.0.3. An authenticated attacker with create/update permissions on charts or dashboards could store a script or add a specific HTML snippet that would act as a stored XSS. This was reported by someone at Praetorian, and they will likely publish a vulnerability analysis and Proof of Concept.
🔗 https://lists.apache.org/thread/wjyvz8om9nwd396lh0bt156mtwjxpsvx

#Apache #Superset #vulnerability #CVE_2023_49657 #XSS

##

CVE-2024-23678
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

2 posts

In Splunk Enterprise for Windows versions below 9.0.8 and 9.1.3, Splunk Enterprise does not correctly sanitize path input data. This results in the unsafe deserialization of untrusted data from a separate disk partition on the machine. This vulnerability only affects Splunk Enterprise for Windows.

jbhall56 at 2024-01-24T12:16:45.429Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-23678, the high-severity flaw is described as an issue related to incorrect sanitization of path input data resulting in “the unsafe deserialization of untrusted data from a separate disk partition on the machine”. https://www.securityweek.com/high-severity-vulnerability-patched-in-splunk-enterprise/

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-24T12:16:45.000Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-23678, the high-severity flaw is described as an issue related to incorrect sanitization of path input data resulting in “the unsafe deserialization of untrusted data from a separate disk partition on the machine”. https://www.securityweek.com/high-severity-vulnerability-patched-in-splunk-enterprise/

CVE-2023-46838(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.05%

1 posts

Transmit requests in Xen's virtual network protocol can consist of multiple parts. While not really useful, except for the initial part any of them may be of zero length, i.e. carry no data at all. Besides a certain initial portion of the to be transferred data, these parts are directly translated into what Linux calls SKB fragments. Such converted request parts can, when for a particular SKB t

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-23T14:26:31.000Z ##

Citrix Hypervisor Security Bulletin for CVE-2023-46838. "An issue has been discovered that affects Citrix Hypervisor 8.2 CU1 LTSR and may allow malicious privileged code in a guest VM to cause the host to crash or become unresponsive." We have released a hotfix (NOTE: NOT A PROPER PATCH) to address this issue.
🔗 https://support.citrix.com/article/CTX587605/citrix-hypervisor-security-bulletin-for-cve202346838

#CVE202346838 #Citrix #Hypervisor #vulnerability #PatchTuesday

CVE-2023-6200
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

4 posts

A race condition was found in the Linux Kernel. Under certain conditions, an unauthenticated attacker from an adjacent network could send an ICMPv6 router advertisement packet, causing arbitrary code execution.

has already patches.

(Unfortunately the ipv6 forum helped them.)

The Image Protector WordPress plugin through 1.1 does not properly sanitize some of its settings, which could allow high-privilege users to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup).

##

CVE-2023-6546
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

1 posts

A race condition was found in the GSM 0710 tty multiplexor in the Linux kernel. This issue occurs when two threads execute the GSMIOC_SETCONF ioctl on the same tty file descriptor with the gsm line discipline enabled, and can lead to a use-after-free problem on a struct gsm_dlci while restarting the gsm mux. This could allow a local unprivileged user to escalate their privileges on the system.

raptor@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-20T06:58:32.000Z ##

#Linux #Kernel #GSM Multiplexing Race Condition Local Privilege Escalation #Vulnerability (CVE-2023-6546)

https://github.com/Nassim-Asrir/ZDI-24-020

CVE-2024-0727
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

Issue summary: Processing a maliciously formatted PKCS12 file may lead OpenSSL to crash leading to a potential Denial of Service attack Impact summary: Applications loading files in the PKCS12 format from untrusted sources might terminate abruptly. A file in PKCS12 format can contain certificates and keys and may come from an untrusted source. The PKCS12 specification allows certain fields to be

- CVE-2023-6237
- CVE-2024-0727

##

CVE-2023-45779
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

4 posts

In TBD of TBD, there is a possible malicious update to platform components due to improperly used crypto. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.

1 repos

https://github.com/metaredteam/rtx-cve-2023-45779

jbhall56 at 2024-02-01T13:08:55.461Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2023-45779, the flaw was discovered by Meta's Red Team X in early September 2023 and was addressed in Android's December 2023 security update without disclosing details an attacker could use to discern and exploit it. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/exploit-released-for-android-local-elevation-flaw-impacting-7-oems/

##
MishaalRahman@androiddev.social at 2024-01-30T16:31:57.000Z ##

The technical write-up for CVE-2023-45779 has been published by Tom Hebb of Meta's Red Team X, revealing that several Android OEMs such as ASUS, Fairphone, Lenovo, Microsoft, Nokia, Nothing, and Vivo, were signing some of their APEX modules with the test keys publicly available in AOSP.

This would have allowed a user or attacker (with shell privileges) to forge an APEX update to "gain near-total control over [the device]."

(1/3)

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-01T13:08:55.000Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2023-45779, the flaw was discovered by Meta's Red Team X in early September 2023 and was addressed in Android's December 2023 security update without disclosing details an attacker could use to discern and exploit it. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/exploit-released-for-android-local-elevation-flaw-impacting-7-oems/

##
MishaalRahman@androiddev.social at 2024-01-30T16:31:57.000Z ##

The technical write-up for CVE-2023-45779 has been published by Tom Hebb of Meta's Red Team X, revealing that several Android OEMs such as ASUS, Fairphone, Lenovo, Microsoft, Nokia, Nothing, and Vivo, were signing some of their APEX modules with the test keys publicly available in AOSP.

This would have allowed a user or attacker (with shell privileges) to forge an APEX update to "gain near-total control over [the device]."

(1/3)

##

CVE-2014-0017(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

The RAND_bytes function in libssh before 0.6.3, when forking is enabled, does not properly reset the state of the OpenSSL pseudo-random number generator (PRNG), which causes the state to be shared between children processes and allows local users to obtain sensitive information by leveraging a pid collision.

emaste@mastodon.social at 2024-01-31T22:30:01.000Z ##

@simondassow @gyptazy E.g. in a writeup for CVE-2014-0016 and CVE-2014-0017:

> OSes with sequential PID generation are then less vulnerable than OSes with random PID (AFAIK only OpenBSD).

https://blog.0xbadc0de.be/archives/218#more-218

##
emaste@mastodon.social at 2024-01-31T22:30:01.000Z ##

@simondassow @gyptazy E.g. in a writeup for CVE-2014-0016 and CVE-2014-0017:

> OSes with sequential PID generation are then less vulnerable than OSes with random PID (AFAIK only OpenBSD).

https://blog.0xbadc0de.be/archives/218#more-218

CVE-2023-43786
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

3 posts

A vulnerability was found in libX11 due to an infinite loop within the PutSubImage() function. This flaw allows a local user to consume all available system resources and cause a denial of service condition.

1 repos

https://github.com/jfrog/jfrog-CVE-2023-43786-libX11_DoS

CVE-2023-43787
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

3 posts

A vulnerability was found in libX11 due to an integer overflow within the XCreateImage() function. This flaw allows a local user to trigger an integer overflow and execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges.

CVE-2023-37518
(6.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

HCL BigFix ServiceNow is vulnerable to arbitrary code injection. A malicious authorized attacker could inject arbitrary code and execute within the context of the running user.

H3liumb0y at 2024-01-31T10:05:03.825Z ##

"🔓 #HCLDomino Vulnerability Alert: CVE-2023-37518 - A Critical Code Injection Risk! 🎯"

🚨 Attention InfoSec community! HCL Domino's BigFix ServiceNow module has a critical vulnerability - CVE-2023-37518. This flaw allows arbitrary code injection by an authorized attacker, posing a substantial risk to system integrity and data confidentiality. 🛡️💻

The vulnerability has a medium severity rating (CVSS v3: 6.4). Attack vector involves network access, with low complexity and low privilege requirements, making it a concerning security loophole. No user interaction is needed, amplifying the risk. 🌐🔐

Stay vigilant and ensure systems are updated to mitigate this threat. For detailed insights, check Tenable and OpenCVE.

Tags: #CyberSecurity #Vulnerability #CodeInjection #CVE202337518 #BigFix #ServiceNow #InfoSec #PatchManagement 🛠️🔒

##

CVE-2024-21888
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

38 posts

A privilege escalation vulnerability in web component of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Policy Secure (9.x, 22.x) allows a user to elevate privileges to that of an administrator.

H3liumb0y at 2024-02-01T06:19:33.442Z ##

"🚨 2x High Alert: Ivanti's CVE-2024-21888 - Privilege Escalation Vulnerability AND CVE-2024-21893 - Server-side request forgery vulnerability in the SAML component of Ivanti Connect Secure🚨"

A high-severity vulnerability, CVE-2024-21888, has been identified in Ivanti Connect Secure & Ivanti Policy Secure (versions 9.x, 22.x). This vulnerability permits privilege escalation, allowing a user to gain administrative privileges.

And also a high vulnerability, named CVE-2024-21893, has been discovered in Ivanti Connect Secure and Policy Secure up to versions 9.1R18/22.6R2. This vulnerability affects the SAML component and can be exploited remotely. It allows an attacker to manipulate unknown input, leading to a server-side request forgery issue. There is no publicly available exploit.

A patch has been released to address this vulnerability. Admins are advised to apply patches ASAP and consider a factory reset of devices as an extra precaution.

Tags: #CyberSecurity #VulnerabilityAlert #Ivanti #CVE202421888 #CVE2024221893 #PrivilegeEscalation #PatchManagement #InfosecCommunity #SystemAdmins 🔐💻🛡️

Source: Ivanti's Forums Tenable

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-01T06:19:33.000Z ##

"🚨 2x High Alert: Ivanti's CVE-2024-21888 - Privilege Escalation Vulnerability AND CVE-2024-21893 - Server-side request forgery vulnerability in the SAML component of Ivanti Connect Secure🚨"

A high-severity vulnerability, CVE-2024-21888, has been identified in Ivanti Connect Secure & Ivanti Policy Secure (versions 9.x, 22.x). This vulnerability permits privilege escalation, allowing a user to gain administrative privileges.

And also a high vulnerability, named CVE-2024-21893, has been discovered in Ivanti Connect Secure and Policy Secure up to versions 9.1R18/22.6R2. This vulnerability affects the SAML component and can be exploited remotely. It allows an attacker to manipulate unknown input, leading to a server-side request forgery issue. There is no publicly available exploit.

A patch has been released to address this vulnerability. Admins are advised to apply patches ASAP and consider a factory reset of devices as an extra precaution.

Tags: #CyberSecurity #VulnerabilityAlert #Ivanti #CVE202421888 #CVE2024221893 #PrivilegeEscalation #PatchManagement #InfosecCommunity #SystemAdmins 🔐💻🛡️

Ivanti updated their knowledge base article with an available patch:

Update 1 February: A patch addressing all known vulnerabilities is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure version 22.5R2.2 and Ivanti Policy Secure 22.5R1.1.

https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
simontsui at 2024-02-01T16:17:03.942Z ##

CISA released supplemental directions for Emergency Directive 24-01 Mitigate Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure Vulnerabilities. This assumes anyone running Ivanti Connect Secure or Ivanti Policy Secure solutions have been compromised and the remediation steps include isolating the device from resources, continue threat hunting, performing a factory reset, applying the patch, etc.
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/directives/ed-24-01-mitigate-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-vulnerabilities#SupplementalDirectionV1

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893 #EmergencyDirective

CISA added yet another vulnerability to the KEV Catalog on the same day. (I get the feeling that they don't like doing that): CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high) Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure, and Neurons Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) Vulnerability
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/31/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog-0

Hot off the press! Mandiant released additional information about post-exploitation activity by the suspected Chinese state-sponsored threat actor UNC5221 (tracked by Volexity as UTA0178) and provided IOC.
🔗 https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/investigating-ivanti-zero-day-exploitation

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
simontsui at 2024-01-31T11:44:46.869Z ##

Ivanti identified two new vulnerabilities (one actively exploited) in connection to the Ivanti Connect Secure zero-days from 10 January 2024. They are:

  • CVE-2024-21888 (8.8 high) privilege escalation in web component "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time"
  • CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high, exploited in the wild) sever side request forgery (SSRF) in the SAML component "At the time of publication, the exploitation of CVE-2024-21893 appears to be targeted"

A patch is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1) and ZTA version 22.6R1.3.
🔗 https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
blog post: https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways
security advisory: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2024-21888-Privilege-Escalation-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure?language=en_US

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-31T11:44:46.000Z ##

Ivanti identified two new vulnerabilities (one actively exploited) in connection to the Ivanti Connect Secure zero-days from 10 January 2024. They are:

  • CVE-2024-21888 (8.8 high) privilege escalation in web component "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time"
  • CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high, exploited in the wild) sever side request forgery (SSRF) in the SAML component "At the time of publication, the exploitation of CVE-2024-21893 appears to be targeted"

A patch is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1) and ZTA version 22.6R1.3.
🔗 https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
blog post: https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways
security advisory: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2024-21888-Privilege-Escalation-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure?language=en_US

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
H3liumb0y at 2024-02-01T06:19:33.442Z ##

"🚨 2x High Alert: Ivanti's CVE-2024-21888 - Privilege Escalation Vulnerability AND CVE-2024-21893 - Server-side request forgery vulnerability in the SAML component of Ivanti Connect Secure🚨"

A high-severity vulnerability, CVE-2024-21888, has been identified in Ivanti Connect Secure & Ivanti Policy Secure (versions 9.x, 22.x). This vulnerability permits privilege escalation, allowing a user to gain administrative privileges.

And also a high vulnerability, named CVE-2024-21893, has been discovered in Ivanti Connect Secure and Policy Secure up to versions 9.1R18/22.6R2. This vulnerability affects the SAML component and can be exploited remotely. It allows an attacker to manipulate unknown input, leading to a server-side request forgery issue. There is no publicly available exploit.

A patch has been released to address this vulnerability. Admins are advised to apply patches ASAP and consider a factory reset of devices as an extra precaution.

Tags: #CyberSecurity #VulnerabilityAlert #Ivanti #CVE202421888 #CVE2024221893 #PrivilegeEscalation #PatchManagement #InfosecCommunity #SystemAdmins 🔐💻🛡️

Source: Ivanti's Forums Tenable

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-01T06:19:33.000Z ##

"🚨 2x High Alert: Ivanti's CVE-2024-21888 - Privilege Escalation Vulnerability AND CVE-2024-21893 - Server-side request forgery vulnerability in the SAML component of Ivanti Connect Secure🚨"

A high-severity vulnerability, CVE-2024-21888, has been identified in Ivanti Connect Secure & Ivanti Policy Secure (versions 9.x, 22.x). This vulnerability permits privilege escalation, allowing a user to gain administrative privileges.

And also a high vulnerability, named CVE-2024-21893, has been discovered in Ivanti Connect Secure and Policy Secure up to versions 9.1R18/22.6R2. This vulnerability affects the SAML component and can be exploited remotely. It allows an attacker to manipulate unknown input, leading to a server-side request forgery issue. There is no publicly available exploit.

A patch has been released to address this vulnerability. Admins are advised to apply patches ASAP and consider a factory reset of devices as an extra precaution.

Tags: #CyberSecurity #VulnerabilityAlert #Ivanti #CVE202421888 #CVE2024221893 #PrivilegeEscalation #PatchManagement #InfosecCommunity #SystemAdmins 🔐💻🛡️

Source: Ivanti's Forums Tenable

##
simontsui at 2024-02-02T15:35:27.969Z ##

watchTowr reports additional zero-days uncovered on a fully patched Ivanti appliance. No further information due to 90 day vulnerability disclosure policy.
🔗 https://twitter.com/watchtowrcyber/status/1753366975609475472 (just in case someone wants to view it for themselves)

##
simontsui at 2024-02-01T20:32:38.427Z ##

Ivanti updated their knowledge base article with an available patch:

Update 1 February: A patch addressing all known vulnerabilities is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure version 22.5R2.2 and Ivanti Policy Secure 22.5R1.1.

https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
simontsui at 2024-02-01T16:17:03.942Z ##

CISA released supplemental directions for Emergency Directive 24-01 Mitigate Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure Vulnerabilities. This assumes anyone running Ivanti Connect Secure or Ivanti Policy Secure solutions have been compromised and the remediation steps include isolating the device from resources, continue threat hunting, performing a factory reset, applying the patch, etc.
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/directives/ed-24-01-mitigate-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-vulnerabilities#SupplementalDirectionV1

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893 #EmergencyDirective

##
simontsui at 2024-02-01T01:13:29.622Z ##

CISA added yet another vulnerability to the KEV Catalog on the same day. (I get the feeling that they don't like doing that): CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high) Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure, and Neurons Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) Vulnerability
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/31/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog-0

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
simontsui at 2024-01-31T15:00:14.741Z ##

Hot off the press! Mandiant released additional information about post-exploitation activity by the suspected Chinese state-sponsored threat actor UNC5221 (tracked by Volexity as UTA0178) and provided IOC.
🔗 https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/investigating-ivanti-zero-day-exploitation

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
simontsui at 2024-01-31T11:44:46.869Z ##

Ivanti identified two new vulnerabilities (one actively exploited) in connection to the Ivanti Connect Secure zero-days from 10 January 2024. They are:

  • CVE-2024-21888 (8.8 high) privilege escalation in web component "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time"
  • CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high, exploited in the wild) sever side request forgery (SSRF) in the SAML component "At the time of publication, the exploitation of CVE-2024-21893 appears to be targeted"

A patch is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1) and ZTA version 22.6R1.3.
🔗 https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
blog post: https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways
security advisory: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2024-21888-Privilege-Escalation-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure?language=en_US

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-31T11:44:46.000Z ##

Ivanti identified two new vulnerabilities (one actively exploited) in connection to the Ivanti Connect Secure zero-days from 10 January 2024. They are:

  • CVE-2024-21888 (8.8 high) privilege escalation in web component "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time"
  • CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high, exploited in the wild) sever side request forgery (SSRF) in the SAML component "At the time of publication, the exploitation of CVE-2024-21893 appears to be targeted"

A patch is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1) and ZTA version 22.6R1.3.
🔗 https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
blog post: https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways
security advisory: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2024-21888-Privilege-Escalation-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure?language=en_US

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
simontsui at 2024-02-02T17:37:38.440Z ##

@wdormann watchTowr reports additional zero-days discovered while trying to reproduce the Ivanti CVEs CVE-2024-21888 and CVE-2024-21893:
https://twitter.com/watchtowrcyber/status/1753366975609475472

##
simontsui at 2024-02-01T20:22:13.714Z ##

@dangoodin Patch testing takes time to ensure that threat actors don't figure out a way to bypass the patch, which would then be in itself a new zero-day (when someone other than the vendor knows an existing vulnerability). During their continued investigation and patch testing, they discovered CVE-2024-21888, which they stated "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time" and CVE-2024-21893 (We are only aware of a small number of customers who have been impacted by CVE-2024-21893 at this time.)

The patch they released for about 7 versions of products (Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2, 22.5R1.1 and 22.5R2.2), Ivanti Policy Secure version 22.5R1.1 and ZTA version 22.6R1.3) fix all four vulnerabilities instead of hotfixing two and needing additional patches. "CVE-2023-46805, CVE-2024-21887, CVE-2024-21888, and CVE-2024-21893 are all remediated with the patch."

I can't believe I'm defending Ivanti but rushing a patch would have been worse.

##
simontsui at 2024-01-31T14:27:32.148Z ##

@cert_eu It should be noted in this toot that " A patch is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1) and ZTA version 22.6R1.3." https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
" CVE-2023-46805, CVE-2024-21887, CVE-2024-21888, and CVE-2024-21893 are all remediated with the patch." https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways

##
simontsui at 2024-01-31T13:25:43.480Z ##

@da_667

  • CVE-2024-21888 (8.8 high) A privilege escalation vulnerability in web component of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Policy Secure (9.x, 22.x) allows a user to elevate privileges to that of an administrator. "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time"
  • CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high, exploited in the wild) A server-side request forgery vulnerability in the SAML component of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x), Ivanti Policy Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Neurons for ZTA allows an attacker to access certain restricted resources without authentication. "At the time of publication, the exploitation of CVE-2024-21893 appears to be targeted"
##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2024-01-31T11:34:07.000Z ##

More hilarity on #ConnectAround - there’s now two NEW vulnerabilities in Ivanti Pulse Secure, being actively exploited as zero days too - no patches for many versions.

Updated advisory with updated mitigations you need to reapply:
https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

CVEs: CVE-2024-21893 and CVE-2024-21888

CERT advisory: https://www.bsi.bund.de/SharedDocs/Cybersicherheitswarnungen/DE/2024/2024-205101-1032.pdf?__blob=publicationFile&v=2

Ivanti recommend you factory reset your devices in their advisory.

HT @fthy

#threatintel

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-01T20:22:13.000Z ##

@dangoodin Patch testing takes time to ensure that threat actors don't figure out a way to bypass the patch, which would then be in itself a new zero-day (when someone other than the vendor knows an existing vulnerability). During their continued investigation and patch testing, they discovered CVE-2024-21888, which they stated "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time" and CVE-2024-21893 (We are only aware of a small number of customers who have been impacted by CVE-2024-21893 at this time.)

The patch they released for about 7 versions of products (Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2, 22.5R1.1 and 22.5R2.2), Ivanti Policy Secure version 22.5R1.1 and ZTA version 22.6R1.3) fix all four vulnerabilities instead of hotfixing two and needing additional patches. "CVE-2023-46805, CVE-2024-21887, CVE-2024-21888, and CVE-2024-21893 are all remediated with the patch."

I can't believe I'm defending Ivanti but rushing a patch would have been worse.

##
neustradamus@mastodon.social at 2024-02-02T12:38:44.000Z ##

#Mastodon 4.2.5 has been released (#OStatus / #ActivityPub / #Fediverse / #SocialNetwork / #CVE / #CVE202423832) http://mastodon.social/

##
fj@mastodon.social at 2024-02-01T15:53:15.000Z ##

Thank you @arcanicanis for making us users on here safer and reporting this critical Mastodon vulnerability.

And @Gargron and team for the prompt fix and patching of mastodon.social.

If your instance isn't patched, you should probably ping your admin.

"Due to insufficient origin validation in all Mastodon, attackers can impersonate and take over any remote account.”

https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/security/advisories/GHSA-3fjr-858r-92rw

#Mastodon #MastoSec #CVE_2024_23832 #MastoAdmin

##
sys64738@gomoot.com at 2024-02-02T08:56:03.000Z ##

Mastodon, la piattaforma di microblogging federata e open source, nelle ultime ore sta affrontando una grave vulnerabilità di sicurezza che consente il furto di identità degli utenti. La falla, identificata con la CVE-ID CVE-2024-23832, ha ricevuto un punteggio di gravità di 9,4 su 10 secondo il Common Vulnerability Scoring System. La vulnerabilità è stata […]

https://gomoot.com/vulnerabilita-in-mastodon/

##
henningsieh@social.tchncs.de at 2024-02-02T07:27:05.000Z ##

Oh, #Mastodon ist offener als Polen… 🫣

**Mastodon: Diebstahl beliebiger Identitäten im föderierten Kurznachrichtendienst**

https://www.heise.de/news/Mastodon-Diebstahl-beliebiger-Identitaeten-im-foederierten-Kurznachrichtendienst-9615961.html

- CVE: https://www.opencve.io/cve/CVE-2024-23832
- Description: https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/security/advisories/GHSA-3fjr-858r-92rw
- Fix: https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/commit/1726085db5cd73dd30953da858f9887bcc90b958

##
jfml@mastodon.art at 2024-02-02T06:48:14.000Z ##

Ooof, there's a #critical #security #issue (# CVE-2024-23832) on older #Mastodon #instances where remote attackers can #takeover and #impersonate any account:

https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/security/advisories/GHSA-3fjr-858r-92rw

via @heisec: https://www.heise.de/news/Mastodon-Diebstahl-beliebiger-Identitaeten-im-foederierten-Kurznachrichtendienst-9615961.html

Update your instances, friends! 4.2.5 seems to be safe.

CVE-2024-23832

Local instance has been patched to 4.2.5 and all services are running.

rober@masto.es at 2024-02-01T20:34:38.000Z ##

Mastodon en https://masto.es ha sido actualizado a la versión 4.2.5, que incluye un arreglo de un fallo crítico de seguridad (CVE-2024-23832 - Suplantación y control de usuarios remotos).

##
anthropy@mastodon.derg.nz at 2024-02-01T19:41:59.000Z ##

With the advent of a security vulnerability in Mastodon CVE-2024-23832, I see a lot of people (finally) updating their servers. Every Mastodon version prior to 3.5.17 is vulnerable, as well as 4.0.x versions prior to 4.0.13, 4.1.x version prior to 4.1.13, and 4.2.x versions prior to 4.2.5.

If you run into issues after doing upgrades, here's a quick thing I slapped together detailing some of the things that can go wrong with usual upgrades/migrations, and how to fix them: https://derg.nz/dragonhive/web/sysadmin/kb/blog/2023/10/02/how-to-fix-mastodon.html

##
mods@union.sh at 2024-02-01T18:37:26.000Z ##

Union.sh has been updated to 4.2.5 which was released earlier today to address a critical security issue.

- Fix insufficient origin validation (CVE-2024-23832, GHSA-3fjr-858r-92rw)

https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/releases/tag/v4.2.5

Also see https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-23832

#MastoAdmin #Mastodon

##
jeroen@habets.dev at 2024-02-01T18:19:05.000Z ##

##
ron@social.amichan.de at 2024-02-01T18:03:48.000Z ##

Heute muss ein dringendes Mastodon-Sicherheits-Update eingespielt werden.
Mastodon selbst meint dazu: **This release is an important security release fixing a critical security issue (CVE-2024-23832).**

Die Schritte sind einfach:

sudo su mastodon
cd /home/mastodon/live
git fetch --tags
git checkout v4.2.5
bundle install
yarn install --frozen-lockfile
RAILS_ENV=production bundle exec rails assets:precompile
exit
sudo systemctl restart mastodon-sidekiq
sudo systemctl reload mastodon-web
sudo systemctl restart mastodon-streaming

Danach meldet die Oberfläche das Update auf 4.2.5
Achtung: ich bin von 4.2.4 auf die neue Version gegangen. Ggf muss man, wenn man von einer früheren version installiert andere Schritte vornehmen!

Vielen Dank an Hagen (@hbauer) Für die Info zum Update.

#mastodon #update #securityfix #anleitung

##
vmstan@vmst.io at 2024-02-01T15:06:42.000Z ##

Mastodon patches which address CVE-2024-23832 have been released. It addresses a flaw in ActivityPub origin validation.
https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2024-23832
https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/security/advisories/GHSA-3fjr-858r-92rw
(More details forthcoming)

4.2.5
https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/releases/tag/v4.2.5

4.1.13
https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/releases/tag/v4.1.13

4.0.13
https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/releases/tag/v4.0.13

3.5.17
https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/releases/tag/v3.5.17

#MastoAdmin running 4.2 or higher should get alerts in their dashboards and via email to apply this critical update.

Docker images:
https://hub.docker.com/r/tootsuite/mastodon
https://github.com/orgs/mastodon/packages?repo_name=mastodon

The Mastodon team has created patches for major forks so Glitch, Hometown, and Fedibird should also have updates.

#MastoAdmin

##

CVE-2024-221893
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

N/A

H3liumb0y at 2024-02-01T06:19:33.442Z ##

"🚨 2x High Alert: Ivanti's CVE-2024-21888 - Privilege Escalation Vulnerability AND CVE-2024-21893 - Server-side request forgery vulnerability in the SAML component of Ivanti Connect Secure🚨"

A high-severity vulnerability, CVE-2024-21888, has been identified in Ivanti Connect Secure & Ivanti Policy Secure (versions 9.x, 22.x). This vulnerability permits privilege escalation, allowing a user to gain administrative privileges.

And also a high vulnerability, named CVE-2024-21893, has been discovered in Ivanti Connect Secure and Policy Secure up to versions 9.1R18/22.6R2. This vulnerability affects the SAML component and can be exploited remotely. It allows an attacker to manipulate unknown input, leading to a server-side request forgery issue. There is no publicly available exploit.

A patch has been released to address this vulnerability. Admins are advised to apply patches ASAP and consider a factory reset of devices as an extra precaution.

Tags: #CyberSecurity #VulnerabilityAlert #Ivanti #CVE202421888 #CVE2024221893 #PrivilegeEscalation #PatchManagement #InfosecCommunity #SystemAdmins 🔐💻🛡️

Source: Ivanti's Forums Tenable

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-01T06:19:33.000Z ##

"🚨 2x High Alert: Ivanti's CVE-2024-21888 - Privilege Escalation Vulnerability AND CVE-2024-21893 - Server-side request forgery vulnerability in the SAML component of Ivanti Connect Secure🚨"

A high-severity vulnerability, CVE-2024-21888, has been identified in Ivanti Connect Secure & Ivanti Policy Secure (versions 9.x, 22.x). This vulnerability permits privilege escalation, allowing a user to gain administrative privileges.

And also a high vulnerability, named CVE-2024-21893, has been discovered in Ivanti Connect Secure and Policy Secure up to versions 9.1R18/22.6R2. This vulnerability affects the SAML component and can be exploited remotely. It allows an attacker to manipulate unknown input, leading to a server-side request forgery issue. There is no publicly available exploit.

A patch has been released to address this vulnerability. Admins are advised to apply patches ASAP and consider a factory reset of devices as an extra precaution.

Tags: #CyberSecurity #VulnerabilityAlert #Ivanti #CVE202421888 #CVE2024221893 #PrivilegeEscalation #PatchManagement #InfosecCommunity #SystemAdmins 🔐💻🛡️

##

CVE-2024-21893
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

38 posts

A server-side request forgery vulnerability in the SAML component of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Policy Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Neurons for ZTA allows an attacker to access certain restricted resources without authentication.

simontsui at 2024-02-02T15:35:27.969Z ##

watchTowr reports additional zero-days uncovered on a fully patched Ivanti appliance. No further information due to 90 day vulnerability disclosure policy.
🔗 https://twitter.com/watchtowrcyber/status/1753366975609475472 (just in case someone wants to view it for themselves)

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888
#CVE_2024_21893

cc: @todb @ntkramer @serghei @dangoodin @catc0n

##
simontsui at 2024-02-01T20:32:38.427Z ##

Ivanti updated their knowledge base article with an available patch:

Update 1 February: A patch addressing all known vulnerabilities is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure version 22.5R2.2 and Ivanti Policy Secure 22.5R1.1.

https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
simontsui at 2024-02-01T16:17:03.942Z ##

CISA released supplemental directions for Emergency Directive 24-01 Mitigate Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure Vulnerabilities. This assumes anyone running Ivanti Connect Secure or Ivanti Policy Secure solutions have been compromised and the remediation steps include isolating the device from resources, continue threat hunting, performing a factory reset, applying the patch, etc.
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/directives/ed-24-01-mitigate-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-vulnerabilities#SupplementalDirectionV1

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893 #EmergencyDirective

##
simontsui at 2024-02-01T01:13:29.622Z ##

CISA added yet another vulnerability to the KEV Catalog on the same day. (I get the feeling that they don't like doing that): CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high) Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure, and Neurons Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) Vulnerability
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/31/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog-0

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
simontsui at 2024-01-31T15:00:14.741Z ##

Hot off the press! Mandiant released additional information about post-exploitation activity by the suspected Chinese state-sponsored threat actor UNC5221 (tracked by Volexity as UTA0178) and provided IOC.
🔗 https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/investigating-ivanti-zero-day-exploitation

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
simontsui at 2024-01-31T11:44:46.869Z ##

Ivanti identified two new vulnerabilities (one actively exploited) in connection to the Ivanti Connect Secure zero-days from 10 January 2024. They are:

  • CVE-2024-21888 (8.8 high) privilege escalation in web component "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time"
  • CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high, exploited in the wild) sever side request forgery (SSRF) in the SAML component "At the time of publication, the exploitation of CVE-2024-21893 appears to be targeted"

A patch is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1) and ZTA version 22.6R1.3.
🔗 https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
blog post: https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways
security advisory: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2024-21888-Privilege-Escalation-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure?language=en_US

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-02T15:35:27.000Z ##

watchTowr reports additional zero-days uncovered on a fully patched Ivanti appliance. No further information due to 90 day vulnerability disclosure policy.
🔗 https://twitter.com/watchtowrcyber/status/1753366975609475472 (just in case someone wants to view it for themselves)

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888
#CVE_2024_21893

cc: @todb @ntkramer @serghei @dangoodin @catc0n

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-01T20:32:38.000Z ##

Ivanti updated their knowledge base article with an available patch:

Update 1 February: A patch addressing all known vulnerabilities is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure version 22.5R2.2 and Ivanti Policy Secure 22.5R1.1.

https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-01T16:17:03.000Z ##

CISA released supplemental directions for Emergency Directive 24-01 Mitigate Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure Vulnerabilities. This assumes anyone running Ivanti Connect Secure or Ivanti Policy Secure solutions have been compromised and the remediation steps include isolating the device from resources, continue threat hunting, performing a factory reset, applying the patch, etc.
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/directives/ed-24-01-mitigate-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-vulnerabilities#SupplementalDirectionV1

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893 #EmergencyDirective

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-01T01:13:29.000Z ##

CISA added yet another vulnerability to the KEV Catalog on the same day. (I get the feeling that they don't like doing that): CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high) Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure, and Neurons Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) Vulnerability
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/31/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog-0

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-31T15:00:14.000Z ##

Hot off the press! Mandiant released additional information about post-exploitation activity by the suspected Chinese state-sponsored threat actor UNC5221 (tracked by Volexity as UTA0178) and provided IOC.
🔗 https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/investigating-ivanti-zero-day-exploitation

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-31T11:44:46.000Z ##

Ivanti identified two new vulnerabilities (one actively exploited) in connection to the Ivanti Connect Secure zero-days from 10 January 2024. They are:

  • CVE-2024-21888 (8.8 high) privilege escalation in web component "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time"
  • CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high, exploited in the wild) sever side request forgery (SSRF) in the SAML component "At the time of publication, the exploitation of CVE-2024-21893 appears to be targeted"

A patch is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1) and ZTA version 22.6R1.3.
🔗 https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
blog post: https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways
security advisory: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2024-21888-Privilege-Escalation-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure?language=en_US

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
simontsui at 2024-01-31T11:44:46.869Z ##

Ivanti identified two new vulnerabilities (one actively exploited) in connection to the Ivanti Connect Secure zero-days from 10 January 2024. They are:

  • CVE-2024-21888 (8.8 high) privilege escalation in web component "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time"
  • CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high, exploited in the wild) sever side request forgery (SSRF) in the SAML component "At the time of publication, the exploitation of CVE-2024-21893 appears to be targeted"

A patch is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1) and ZTA version 22.6R1.3.
🔗 https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
blog post: https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways
security advisory: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2024-21888-Privilege-Escalation-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure?language=en_US

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-31T11:44:46.000Z ##

Ivanti identified two new vulnerabilities (one actively exploited) in connection to the Ivanti Connect Secure zero-days from 10 January 2024. They are:

  • CVE-2024-21888 (8.8 high) privilege escalation in web component "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time"
  • CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high, exploited in the wild) sever side request forgery (SSRF) in the SAML component "At the time of publication, the exploitation of CVE-2024-21893 appears to be targeted"

A patch is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1) and ZTA version 22.6R1.3.
🔗 https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
blog post: https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways
security advisory: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2024-21888-Privilege-Escalation-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure?language=en_US

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
simontsui at 2024-02-02T17:37:38.440Z ##

@wdormann watchTowr reports additional zero-days discovered while trying to reproduce the Ivanti CVEs CVE-2024-21888 and CVE-2024-21893:
https://twitter.com/watchtowrcyber/status/1753366975609475472

##
simontsui at 2024-02-01T20:22:13.714Z ##

@dangoodin Patch testing takes time to ensure that threat actors don't figure out a way to bypass the patch, which would then be in itself a new zero-day (when someone other than the vendor knows an existing vulnerability). During their continued investigation and patch testing, they discovered CVE-2024-21888, which they stated "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time" and CVE-2024-21893 (We are only aware of a small number of customers who have been impacted by CVE-2024-21893 at this time.)

The patch they released for about 7 versions of products (Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2, 22.5R1.1 and 22.5R2.2), Ivanti Policy Secure version 22.5R1.1 and ZTA version 22.6R1.3) fix all four vulnerabilities instead of hotfixing two and needing additional patches. "CVE-2023-46805, CVE-2024-21887, CVE-2024-21888, and CVE-2024-21893 are all remediated with the patch."

I can't believe I'm defending Ivanti but rushing a patch would have been worse.

##
h4sh at 2024-02-01T02:20:40.683Z ##

Yet another Ivanti bug.. CVE-2024-21893 SSRF allows unauthenticated access to sensitive resources (CVSS 8.2), added to KEV.

Patch is available to some but not all versions (available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1) and ZTA version 22.6R1.3). The "staggered" release schedule applies for other versions

Ivanti is really on a roll here
#cve
https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-21893

##
simontsui at 2024-02-01T02:07:31.310Z ##

@hrbrmstr @ntkramer today's the second dual CISA KEV Release day, and it's the first month of 2024.

  • https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/31/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog (CVE-2022-48618)
  • https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/31/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog-0 (CVE-2024-21893)
##
simontsui at 2024-01-31T14:27:32.148Z ##

@cert_eu It should be noted in this toot that " A patch is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1) and ZTA version 22.6R1.3." https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
" CVE-2023-46805, CVE-2024-21887, CVE-2024-21888, and CVE-2024-21893 are all remediated with the patch." https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways

##
simontsui at 2024-01-31T13:25:43.480Z ##

@da_667

  • CVE-2024-21888 (8.8 high) A privilege escalation vulnerability in web component of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Policy Secure (9.x, 22.x) allows a user to elevate privileges to that of an administrator. "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time"
  • CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high, exploited in the wild) A server-side request forgery vulnerability in the SAML component of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x), Ivanti Policy Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Neurons for ZTA allows an attacker to access certain restricted resources without authentication. "At the time of publication, the exploitation of CVE-2024-21893 appears to be targeted"
##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2024-01-31T11:34:07.000Z ##

More hilarity on #ConnectAround - there’s now two NEW vulnerabilities in Ivanti Pulse Secure, being actively exploited as zero days too - no patches for many versions.

Updated advisory with updated mitigations you need to reapply:
https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

CVEs: CVE-2024-21893 and CVE-2024-21888

CERT advisory: https://www.bsi.bund.de/SharedDocs/Cybersicherheitswarnungen/DE/2024/2024-205101-1032.pdf?__blob=publicationFile&v=2

Ivanti recommend you factory reset your devices in their advisory.

HT @fthy

#threatintel

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-01T20:22:13.000Z ##

@dangoodin Patch testing takes time to ensure that threat actors don't figure out a way to bypass the patch, which would then be in itself a new zero-day (when someone other than the vendor knows an existing vulnerability). During their continued investigation and patch testing, they discovered CVE-2024-21888, which they stated "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time" and CVE-2024-21893 (We are only aware of a small number of customers who have been impacted by CVE-2024-21893 at this time.)

The patch they released for about 7 versions of products (Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2, 22.5R1.1 and 22.5R2.2), Ivanti Policy Secure version 22.5R1.1 and ZTA version 22.6R1.3) fix all four vulnerabilities instead of hotfixing two and needing additional patches. "CVE-2023-46805, CVE-2024-21887, CVE-2024-21888, and CVE-2024-21893 are all remediated with the patch."

I can't believe I'm defending Ivanti but rushing a patch would have been worse.

#threatintel

##

CVE-2023-6246
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

27 posts

A heap-based buffer overflow was found in the __vsyslog_internal function of the glibc library. This function is called by the syslog and vsyslog functions. This issue occurs when the openlog function was not called, or called with the ident argument set to NULL, and the program name (the basename of argv[0]) is bigger than 1024 bytes, resulting in an application crash or local privilege escalatio

blp@framapiaf.org at 2024-02-02T18:21:48.000Z ##

This made me laugh: https://xeiaso.net/shitposts/no-way-to-prevent-this/CVE-2023-6246/

##
ajn142 at 2024-02-02T18:11:08.371Z ##

@dave_aitel @briankrebs

I do like the point of all the problems patching doesn’t solve. To do the bad thing and borrow military terminology into infosec, I think attack surface reduction is particularly applicable at the strategic level. This is something a CISO should be steering the organization as a whole towards. Patching and inventory are more akin to a tactical level, they’re basics and table stakes that need to be done to be effective, and can hurt significantly if done poorly but don’t help much if done right. Using an example from the article, anything you pick to run your mail server and webmail on besides MS Exchange very likely leverages glibc, and was potentially impacted by CVE-2023-6246. If you don’t patch things like that then congrats, you just undid the strategic efforts at ASR, but if you do patch it that and 2 bucks will buy you a Coke.

##
hnbot@chrispelli.fun at 2024-02-01T20:50:24.000Z ##

"No way to prevent this" say users of only language where this regularly happens - https://xeiaso.net/shitposts/no-way-to-prevent-this/CVE-2023-6246/

#hackernews

##
BenjaminHCCarr@hachyderm.io at 2024-02-01T13:39:01.000Z ##

New #Linux #glibc flaw lets attackers get root on major distros
Qualys confirmed that #Debian 12 and 13, #Ubuntu 23.04 and 23.10, and #Fedora 37 to 39 were all vulnerable to CVE-2023-6246 exploits, allowing any unprivileged user to escalate privileges to full root access on default installations.
https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/new-linux-glibc-flaw-lets-attackers-get-root-on-major-distros/

##
jbhall56 at 2024-02-01T13:00:47.798Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2023-6246 and described as a heap-based buffer overflow, the issue was identified in glibc’s __vsyslog_internal() function, which is called by the widely-used syslog() and vsyslog() logging functions. https://www.securityweek.com/gnu-c-library-vulnerability-leads-to-full-root-access/

##
malwarelab_eu at 2024-02-01T06:56:16.174Z ##

Recent privilege escalation vulnerabilities in GNU C Library #glibc widely used in many #Linux distributions such as #Debian, #Ubuntu, #Fedora and others.

CVE-2023-6246 #privesc #vuln can be triggered via #syslog by using long program name or ident parameter in openlog().

Another vulnerability is in #qsort function. While real-world affected programs are currently not known, this vulnerability is pretty old - since 1992 until now.

Reference: https://blog.qualys.com/vulnerabilities-threat-research/2024/01/30/qualys-tru-discovers-important-vulnerabilities-in-gnu-c-librarys-syslog

This is just another reason to consider using Linux distribution without glibc, for example #Alpine Linux with #musl

##
raptor at 2024-02-01T06:22:02.337Z ##

CVE-2023-6246: Heap-based buffer #overflow in the #glibc's syslog()

* another awesome advisory by @qualys

* love the reference to @solardiz’s exploit from 1997 and the link to insecure.org exploit db (blast from the past!)

* snprintf() return value behavior is a common source of bugs (https://github.com/0xdea/semgrep-rules/blob/main/c/unsafe-ret-snprintf-vsnprintf.yaml)

* in awe of the exploit development strategy 🤩

https://www.qualys.com/2024/01/30/cve-2023-6246/syslog.txt

##
Ichinin at 2024-01-31T19:11:34.008Z ##

@dangoodin Elevation of Privileges - looks like it. According to cve.org, it seems like it can either crash or cause a local privilege elevation:
https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2023-6246

In the Qualys paper ( https://www.qualys.com/2024/01/30/cve-2023-6246/syslog.txt ) they say that the heap overflow can be made better and i wouldn't be surprised if someone produced a more stable exploit for this in a few hours:

"Note: this exploit could certainly be made much more efficient; in
theory, it could even be a one-shot exploit, because we do not need to brute force the ASLR, only the heap layout."

##
dangoodin at 2024-01-31T17:50:39.985Z ##

Trying to figure out what to think about the glibc vulnerabilities affecting most Linux platforms. Is CVE-2023-6246 a big deal? It appears to be only an EoP vulnerability, but it also seems to be the case that it provides a direct path to getting root. Have any of y'all looked into this and have thoughts?

https://www.qualys.com/2024/01/30/cve-2023-6246/syslog.txt

https://blog.qualys.com/vulnerabilities-threat-research/2024/01/30/qualys-tru-discovers-important-vulnerabilities-in-gnu-c-librarys-syslog

##
jbhall56 at 2024-01-31T14:03:02.744Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2023-6246, this security flaw was found in glibc's __vsyslog_internal() function, called by the widely-used syslog and vsyslog functions for writing messages to the system message logger. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/new-linux-glibc-flaw-lets-attackers-get-root-on-major-distros

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-01-31T11:20:04.000Z ##

PoC pubblico per lo sfruttamento della CVE-2023-6246 relativa a glibc (AL02/240131/CSIRT-ITA)

🔗️ [Csirt] https://link.is.it/kpuhe7

##
b9AcE@todon.eu at 2024-01-31T10:02:44.000Z ##

'New Linux glibc flaw lets [local] attackers get root on major distros
[...]
While testing their findings, Qualys confirmed that Debian 12 and 13, Ubuntu 23.04 and 23.10, and Fedora 37 to 39 were all vulnerable to CVE-2023-6246 exploits, allowing any unprivileged user to escalate privileges to full root access on default installations.

Although their tests were limited to a handful of distros, the researchers added that "other distributions are probably also exploitable."'
https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/new-linux-glibc-flaw-lets-attackers-get-root-on-major-distros/

"The vulnerability found in qsort() has affected all glibc versions released since 1992."
https://thehackernews.com/2024/01/new-glibc-flaw-grants-attackers-root.html

##
jvoisin at 2024-01-31T01:06:11.388Z ##

Musings on CVE-2023-6246 on hardened_malloc — https://dustri.org/b/musings-on-cve-2023-6246-on-hardened_malloc.html

##
jschauma@mstdn.social at 2024-01-30T19:12:06.000Z ##

Qualys just published two vulnerabilities in #glibc

- an out-of-bounds read/write in qsort dating back to glibc 1.04 (1992): https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2024/01/30/7
- CVE-2023-6246: Heap-based buffer overflow in syslog() in glibc >=2.37 (August 2022): https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2024/01/30/6

The latter allows for a local user privilege escalation to root.

As usual, the Qualys vulnerability write-ups are excellent and provide a detailed walk-through of the code.

##
harrysintonen at 2024-01-30T18:36:03.489Z ##

CVE-2023-6246 - #glibc syslog() heap-based buffer overflow #vulnerability - https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2024/01/30/6 - Impact: local privilege escalation to root #CVE #infosec

##
ajn142@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-02T18:11:08.000Z ##

@dave_aitel @briankrebs

I do like the point of all the problems patching doesn’t solve. To do the bad thing and borrow military terminology into infosec, I think attack surface reduction is particularly applicable at the strategic level. This is something a CISO should be steering the organization as a whole towards. Patching and inventory are more akin to a tactical level, they’re basics and table stakes that need to be done to be effective, and can hurt significantly if done poorly but don’t help much if done right. Using an example from the article, anything you pick to run your mail server and webmail on besides MS Exchange very likely leverages glibc, and was potentially impacted by CVE-2023-6246. If you don’t patch things like that then congrats, you just undid the strategic efforts at ASR, but if you do patch it that and 2 bucks will buy you a Coke.

##

CVE-2024-1060(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

Use after free in Canvas in Google Chrome prior to 121.0.6167.139 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

simontsui at 2024-02-02T00:26:31.682Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) pumped out 4 Chromium security advisories:

  • Chromium: CVE-2024-1077 Use after free in Network
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-1059 Use after free in WebRTC
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-1060 Use after free in Canvas
  • Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

CVE-2024-21399 (8.3 high severity, CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H) is the oddball vulnerability not coming from the Google Chrome security advisory It's curiously marked RCE when Google has never used that to describe their vulnerabilities. Anyway, Not Publicly Disclosed, Not Exploited, and Exploitation Less Likely.

#Microsoft #MSRC #securityadvisory #vulnerability #Google #Chrome

##
simontsui at 2024-01-30T19:15:46.177Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: 4 vulnerabilities fixed, 3 were externally reported. All three are high severity Use After Free in: Canvas (CVE-2024-1060), WebRTC (CVE-2024-1059), and Network (CVE-2024-1077). No mention of exploitation.
🔗 https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/01/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_30.html

#Google #Chrome #vulnerability #PatchTuesday

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-02T00:26:31.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) pumped out 4 Chromium security advisories:

  • Chromium: CVE-2024-1077 Use after free in Network
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-1059 Use after free in WebRTC
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-1060 Use after free in Canvas
  • Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

CVE-2024-21399 (8.3 high severity, CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H) is the oddball vulnerability not coming from the Google Chrome security advisory It's curiously marked RCE when Google has never used that to describe their vulnerabilities. Anyway, Not Publicly Disclosed, Not Exploited, and Exploitation Less Likely.

#Microsoft #MSRC #securityadvisory #vulnerability #Google #Chrome

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-30T19:15:46.000Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: 4 vulnerabilities fixed, 3 were externally reported. All three are high severity Use After Free in: Canvas (CVE-2024-1060), WebRTC (CVE-2024-1059), and Network (CVE-2024-1077). No mention of exploitation.
🔗 https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/01/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_30.html

CVE-2024-21399
(8.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

simontsui at 2024-02-02T00:26:31.682Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) pumped out 4 Chromium security advisories:

  • Chromium: CVE-2024-1077 Use after free in Network
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-1059 Use after free in WebRTC
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-1060 Use after free in Canvas
  • Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

CVE-2024-21399 (8.3 high severity, CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H) is the oddball vulnerability not coming from the Google Chrome security advisory It's curiously marked RCE when Google has never used that to describe their vulnerabilities. Anyway, Not Publicly Disclosed, Not Exploited, and Exploitation Less Likely.

#Microsoft #MSRC #securityadvisory #vulnerability #Google #Chrome

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-02T00:26:31.000Z ##

  • Chromium: CVE-2024-1077 Use after free in Network
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-1059 Use after free in WebRTC
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-1060 Use after free in Canvas
  • Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

##

CVE-2023-51820(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

An issue in Blurams Lumi Security Camera (A31C) v.2.3.38.12558 allows a physically proximate attackers to execute arbitrary code.

weddige@gruene.social at 2024-02-01T17:36:57.000Z ##

@faker great work! Was a firmware vulnerable to CVE-2023-51820 ever rolled out to the public?

##
faker at 2024-02-01T14:04:37.864Z ##

We have analyzed the security of a Blurams IoT camera.

During the research we were able to gain access to semi-live low resolution images from all online cameras and found a reliable way to compromise the device using the SD card slot (CVE-2023-50488 / CVE-2023-51820).
All vulnerabilities were fixed during the responsible disclosure process.

Read the detailed blog post here: https://infosec.rm-it.de/2024/02/01/blurams-lumi-security-camera-analysis/

##
weddige@gruene.social at 2024-02-01T17:36:57.000Z ##

@faker great work! Was a firmware vulnerable to CVE-2023-51820 ever rolled out to the public?

##
faker@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-01T14:04:37.000Z ##

We have analyzed the security of a Blurams IoT camera.

During the research we were able to gain access to semi-live low resolution images from all online cameras and found a reliable way to compromise the device using the SD card slot (CVE-2023-50488 / CVE-2023-51820).
All vulnerabilities were fixed during the responsible disclosure process.

Read the detailed blog post here: https://infosec.rm-it.de/2024/02/01/blurams-lumi-security-camera-analysis/

##

CVE-2023-50488(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

An issue in Blurams Lumi Security Camera (A31C) v23.0406.435.4120 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code.

faker at 2024-02-01T14:04:37.864Z ##

We have analyzed the security of a Blurams IoT camera.

During the research we were able to gain access to semi-live low resolution images from all online cameras and found a reliable way to compromise the device using the SD card slot (CVE-2023-50488 / CVE-2023-51820).
All vulnerabilities were fixed during the responsible disclosure process.

Read the detailed blog post here: https://infosec.rm-it.de/2024/02/01/blurams-lumi-security-camera-analysis/

##
faker@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-01T14:04:37.000Z ##

We have analyzed the security of a Blurams IoT camera.

During the research we were able to gain access to semi-live low resolution images from all online cameras and found a reliable way to compromise the device using the SD card slot (CVE-2023-50488 / CVE-2023-51820).
All vulnerabilities were fixed during the responsible disclosure process.

Read the detailed blog post here: https://infosec.rm-it.de/2024/02/01/blurams-lumi-security-camera-analysis/

##

CVE-2024-23653
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

BuildKit is a toolkit for converting source code to build artifacts in an efficient, expressive and repeatable manner. In addition to running containers as build steps, BuildKit also provides APIs for running interactive containers based on built images. It was possible to use these APIs to ask BuildKit to run a container with elevated privileges. Normally, running such containers is only allowed

KyanHexagon at 2024-02-01T02:22:20.365Z ##

https://snyk.io/blog/leaky-vessels-docker-runc-container-breakout-vulnerabilities/

Snyk researchers identified four vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-21626, CVE-2024-2365, CVE-2024-23653, and CVE-2024-23652) in core container infrastructure components that allow an attacker to escape the containers and gain unauthorized access to the underlying host operating system. Synk has released two tools that serve as reference implementations for detecting exploit attempts. They also recommend watching for patches from container build and runtime vendors.

##
KyanHexagon@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-01T02:22:20.000Z ##

https://snyk.io/blog/leaky-vessels-docker-runc-container-breakout-vulnerabilities/

Synk has released two tools that serve as reference implementations for detecting exploit attempts. They also recommend watching for patches from container build and runtime vendors.

##

CVE-2024-23652
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

### Impact A malicious BuildKit frontend or Dockerfile using `RUN --mount` could trick the feature that removes empty files created for the mountpoints into removing a file outside the container, from the host system. ### Patches The issue has been fixed in v0.12.5 ### Workarounds Avoid using BuildKit frontend from an untrusted source or building an untrusted Dockerfile containing `RUN --mount`

##

CVE-2024-21626
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

6 posts

### Impact In runc 1.1.11 and earlier, due to an internal file descriptor leak, an attacker could cause a newly-spawned container process (from `runc exec`) to have a working directory in the host filesystem namespace, allowing for a container escape by giving access to the host filesystem ("attack 2"). The same attack could be used by a malicious image to allow a container process to gain access

6 repos

https://github.com/Wall1e/CVE-2024-21626-POC

https://github.com/zpxlz/CVE-2024-21626-POC

https://github.com/NitroCao/CVE-2024-21626

https://github.com/zhangguanzhang/CVE-2024-21626

https://github.com/laysakura/CVE-2024-21626-demo

KyanHexagon at 2024-02-01T02:22:20.365Z ##

https://snyk.io/blog/leaky-vessels-docker-runc-container-breakout-vulnerabilities/

Snyk researchers identified four vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-21626, CVE-2024-2365, CVE-2024-23653, and CVE-2024-23652) in core container infrastructure components that allow an attacker to escape the containers and gain unauthorized access to the underlying host operating system. ##
harrysintonen at 2024-01-31T20:56:28.498Z ##

CVE-2024-21626: runc container breakout #vulnerability through process.cwd trickery and leaked fds - https://github.com/opencontainers/runc/security/advisories/GHSA-xr7r-f8xq-vfvv #infosec #CVE

##
bmitch@fosstodon.org at 2024-01-31T20:21:19.000Z ##

#runc has a security release to fix CVE-2024-21626. It's a container escape using file descriptors, and scored 8.6. So if you run images that you don't fully trust, you'll want to upgrade soon. runc is the underlying runtime of a lot of popular container environments. The fixed release is 1.1.12.

https://github.com/opencontainers/runc/security/advisories/GHSA-xr7r-f8xq-vfvv

##
KyanHexagon@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-01T02:22:20.000Z ##

CVE-2023-6330
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

N/A

simontsui at 2024-01-25T19:44:52.325Z ##

Sophos reported the discovery of three vulnerabilities in Panda Security software stemming from a false alarm incident:

  • CVE-2023-6330 (6.4 medium) Pool Memory Corruption Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-6331 (6.4 medium) Out of Bounds Write Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-6332 (4.1 medium) Arbitrary Memory Read Vulnerability

These were patched in WatchGuard EPDR and Panda AD360 version 8.00.22.0023, and Panda Dome version 22.02.01. No mention of exploitation.
🔗 https://news.sophos.com/en-us/2024/01/25/multiple-vulnerabilities-discovered-in-widely-used-security-driver/

#Sophos #Panda #WatchGuard #vulnerability
